This effect doesn't protect Lucretia Mathias from area effects, such as the explosion of a Fireball. If Lucretia Mathias makes an attack, casts a spell that affects an enemy, or deals damage to another creature, this trait ends until the start of her next turn.

eITSHCYMzJiq5FdG.name: Holy Aura: Pacifying Presence
eITSHCYMzJiq5FdG.description: Lucretia Mathias projects a 60-foot Emanation of holy power. A creature that starts its turn in the Emanation has the &reference[Weakened] condition until the start of its next turn.

Holy Aura: Wrathful Flame.name: Holy Aura: Wrathful Flame
Holy Aura: Wrathful Flame.description: Lucretia Mathias projects a 60-foot Emanation of holy power. A creature that starts its turn in the Emanation takes [[/damage 3d6 radiant & 3d6 fire average]] damage.

Prescient.name: Prescient
Prescient.description: [[lookup @name]] can't be &reference[surprise]{Surprised} while she is conscious.

Unarmored Defense.name: Unarmored Defense
Unarmored Defense.description: While [[lookup @name]] is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, her AC includes her Wisdom modifier (included above).

Undeniable Faith.name: Undeniable Faith
Undeniable Faith.description: [[lookup @name]] automatically succeeds on Constitution saving throws to maintain Concentration on her spells.

Pacifying Touch.name: Pacifying Touch
Pacifying Touch.description: Wisdom Saving Throw: DC 20, one creature within 5 feet of [[lookup @name]]. Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &reference[Incapacitated] condition (save ends). Success: Half damage only. Failure or Success: If this damage reduces the target to 0 Hit Points, the target is stabilized but has the &reference[Unconscious] condition for 1 hour, even after regaining Hit Points.

Pacifying Touch.name: Pacifying Touch
Pacifying Touch.description: You are &reference[incapacitated apply=false]. You can repeat your saving throw against this effect at the end of each of your turns, ending the effect on a success.

Pacifying Touch: Stable.name: Pacifying Touch: Stable
Pacifying Touch: Stable.description: For the next hour, you are stable but &reference[unconscious apply=false], even after regaining hit points.

Sacred Flame.name: Sacred Flame
Sacred Flame.description: Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 20, one creature within 60 feet of [[lookup @name]]. Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &reference[Blinded] condition until the end of its next turn. Success: Half damage only.

Sacred Flame.name: Sacred Flame
Sacred Flame.description: You are &reference[blinded apply=false] until the end of your next turn.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
Lucretia casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 20, +12 to spell attacks; spells other than cantrips are cast at level 9):

At Will: [[/item fJsMXjMqW2Kg9gXL]], [[/item TxEXGCBpOc22qlEA]], [[/item mk4aGmfLnf4PaMwY]]

2/Day Each: [[/item leFi7kqJxllFZgoi]], [[/item gRUqqy6gQIuVdG4w]], [[/item kYDQRl3Fcwrc2igX]], [[/item vM1eAb10TI8EqhMl]], [[/item XJqb0NPE99Uv5Jf1]], [[/item fHixFzI42pia9pHs]], [[/item NSGCtWkRv5yvLw5I]], [[/item PoVgJLpHQpw3lTOt]]

1/Day Each: [[/item gv2cZJmfVx1agLXy]], [[/item a4xVatA26rv78HUJ]], [[/item Y0aSqJbIdA3G8Fnm]], [[/item NJRnIyNoIGkuWsHh]], [[/item ztDBEJmmr13uKU7U]]

Greater Spellcasting.name: Greater Spellcasting
Greater Spellcasting.description:
Lucretia casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 20, +12 to spell attacks; spells other than cantrips are cast at level 9):

1/Day Each: [[/item 21ZS3nNZmo84nYTd]], [[/item oKREKJJloTX4wIzc]], [[/item EFlVQccTW6VDMuBK]], [[/item kzcddEgNaRFm3BPR]], [[/item KN0fTD7HajXytS63]], [[/item Qz0J6kmdU7wOrFKh]]

Divine Intervention.name: Divine Intervention
Divine Intervention.description: [[lookup @name lowercase]] chooses any spell which doesn't require a Reaction to cast. As part of this Epic Action, she casts that spell without Material components. If she uses this Epic Action to cast the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplWish000000]{Wish} spell, she can't use this Epic Action for the next 1d4 days.

Epic Resistance.name: Epic Resistance
Epic Resistance.description: [[lookup @name]] chooses one condition, spell, or other effect currently affecting them and rolls [[/r 1d20]]. On an 11 or higher, the effect ends on them. [[lookup @name]] can use this Epic Action even if they would otherwise be unable to take actions, their actions are being controlled by another creature, or if a spell or effect alters their game statistics.

Epic Boss.name: Epic Boss
Epic Boss.description:
This creature is an Epic Boss, a unique foe designed to pose a solo threat to an entire adventuring party. As such, it has additional game rules that sets it apart from normal creatures:

[[lookup @name]] always takes their turn on Initiative count 20. On their turn, they can use their movement and interaction as normal. However, they do not take an action or Bonus Action on their turn unless forced to do so by a spell or other effect. Instead, [[lookup @name]] takes one of the following Epic Actions at the end of each player character's turn.

All this creature's actions are Epic Actions.

  • @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.monsters.Actor.DLaS7LBA7ONSUJMx.Item.IjyodZy1PO52tSxM]{Pacifying Touch}

  • @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.monsters.Actor.DLaS7LBA7ONSUJMx.Item.OxTk9xPmD2LrdCRU]{Sacred Flame}

  • @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.monsters.Actor.DLaS7LBA7ONSUJMx.Item.mNs7Q034rXT6yDfc]{Spellcasting}

  • @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.monsters.Actor.DLaS7LBA7ONSUJMx.Item.u3yB4X5IDhwWSXfW]{Greater Spellcasting}

  • @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.monsters.Actor.DLaS7LBA7ONSUJMx.Item.ggba3q2hW55p5w8R]{Divine Intervention}

  • @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.monsters.Actor.DLaS7LBA7ONSUJMx.Item.nX4AJLbdVqKzZH1f]{Epic Resistance}

Epic Boss.name: Epic Boss
Epic Boss.description:
This creature is an Epic Boss, a unique foe designed to pose a solo threat to an entire adventuring party. As such, it has additional game rules that sets it apart from normal creatures.

The creature always takes their turn on Initiative count 20. On their turn, they can use their movement and interaction as normal. However, they do not take an action or Bonus Action on their turn unless forced to do so by a spell or other effect. Instead, the creature takes one of the Epic Actions they have available.

Sanctified by Falling Fire.name: Sanctified by Falling Fire
Sanctified by Falling Fire.description: When [[lookup @name]] dies, her soul is pulled into the delerium crystal embedded in her chest.

Gate.name: Gate
Gate.description:
You conjure a portal linking an unoccupied space you can see within range to a precise location on a different plane of existence. The portal is a circular opening, which you can make 5 to 20 feet in diameter. You can orient the portal in any direction you choose. The portal lasts for the duration, and the portal's destination is visible through it.

The portal has a front and a back on each plane where it appears. Travel through the portal is possible only by moving through its front. Anything that does so is instantly transported to the other plane, appearing in the unoccupied space nearest to the portal.

Deities and other planar rulers can prevent portals created by this spell from opening in their presence or anywhere within their domains.

When you cast this spell, you can speak the name of a specific creature (a pseudonym, title, or nickname doesn't work). If that creature is on a plane other than the one you are on, the portal opens next to the named creature and transports it to the nearest unoccupied space on your side of the portal. You gain no special power over the creature, and it is free to act as the DM deems appropriate. It might leave, attack you, or help you.

Greater Restoration.name: Greater Restoration
Greater Restoration.description:
You touch a creature and magically remove one of the following effects from it:

  • 1 &Reference[Exhaustion] level
  • The &Reference[Charmed] or &Reference[Petrified] condition
  • A curse, including the target's Attunement to a cursed magic item
  • Any reduction to one of the target's ability scores
  • Any reduction to the target's Hit Point maximum

materials.value: diamond dust worth 100+ GP, which the spell consumes

Heal.name: Heal
Heal.description:
Choose a creature that you can see within range. Positive energy washes through the target, restoring 70 Hit Points. This spell also ends the &Reference[Blinded], &Reference[Deafened], and &Reference[Poisoned] conditions on the target.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The healing increases by 10 for each spell slot level above 6.

Heroes' Feast.name: Heroes' Feast
Heroes' Feast.description:
You conjure a feast that appears on a surface in an unoccupied 10-foot Cube next to you. The feast takes 1 hour to consume and disappears at the end of that time, and the beneficial effects don't set in until this hour is over. Up to twelve creatures can partake of the feast.

A creature that partakes gains several benefits, which last for 24 hours. The creature has &Reference[damageResistance]{Resistance} to Poison damage, and it has Immunity to the &Reference[Frightened] and &Reference[Poisoned] conditions. Its Hit Point maximum also increases by 2d10, and it gains the same number of Hit Points.

materials.value: a gem-encrusted bowl worth 1,000+ GP, which the spell consumes

affects.special: unoccupied

Consume Feast.name: Consume Feast
Consume Feast.chatFlavor: Hit Point maximum increased by healing amount

Feast's Benefits.name: Feast's Benefits
Feast's Benefits.description: The creature has &Reference[damageResistance]{Resistance} to Poison damage, and it has Immunity to the &Reference[Frightened] and &Reference[Poisoned] conditions. Its Hit Point maximum also increases by 2d10, and it gains the same number of Hit Points.

Resurrection.name: Resurrection
Resurrection.description:
With a touch, you revive a dead creature that has been dead for no more than a century, didn't die of old age, and wasn't Undead when it died.

The creature returns to life with all its Hit Points. This spell also neutralizes any poisons that affected the creature at the time of death. This spell closes all mortal wounds and restores any missing body parts.

Coming back from the dead is an ordeal. The target takes a −4 penalty to D20 Tests. Every time the target finishes a Long Rest, the penalty is reduced by 1 until it becomes 0.

Casting this spell to revive a creature that has been dead for 365 days or longer taxes you. Until you finish a Long Rest, you can't cast spells again, and you have Disadvantage on D20 Tests.

materials.value: a diamond worth 1,000+ GP, which the spell consumes

Resurrection Sickness (Day 1).name: Resurrection Sickness (Day 1)
Resurrection Sickness (Day 1).description: Coming back from the dead is an ordeal. The target takes a −4 penalty to D20 Tests. Every time the target finishes a Long Rest, the penalty is reduced by 1 until it becomes 0.

Resurrection Sickness (Day 2).name: Resurrection Sickness (Day 2)
Resurrection Sickness (Day 2).description: Coming back from the dead is an ordeal. The target takes a −4 penalty to D20 Tests. Every time the target finishes a Long Rest, the penalty is reduced by 1 until it becomes 0.

Resurrection Sickness (Day 3).name: Resurrection Sickness (Day 3)
Resurrection Sickness (Day 3).description: Coming back from the dead is an ordeal. The target takes a −4 penalty to D20 Tests. Every time the target finishes a Long Rest, the penalty is reduced by 1 until it becomes 0.

Resurrection Sickness (Day 4).name: Resurrection Sickness (Day 4)
Resurrection Sickness (Day 4).description: Coming back from the dead is an ordeal. The target takes a −4 penalty to D20 Tests. Every time the target finishes a Long Rest, the penalty is reduced by 1 until it becomes 0.

Spell Taxed.name: Spell Taxed
Spell Taxed.description: Until you finish a Long Rest, you can’t cast spells again, and you have Disadvantage on D20 Tests.

Word of Recall.name: Word of Recall
Word of Recall.description:
You and up to five willing creatures within 5 feet of you instantly teleport to a previously designated sanctuary. You and any creatures that teleport with you appear in the nearest unoccupied space to the spot you designated when you prepared your sanctuary (see below). If you cast this spell without first preparing a sanctuary, the spell has no effect.

You must designate a location, such as a temple, as a sanctuary by casting this spell there.

affects.special: you and five other creatures

Guidance.name: 神导术
Guidance.description: You touch a willing creature and choose a skill. Until the spell ends, the creature adds 1d4 to any ability check using the chosen skill.

Light.name: Light
Light.description:
You touch one Large or smaller object that isn't being worn or carried by someone else. Until the spell ends, the object sheds Bright Light in a 20-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 20 feet. The light can be colored as you like.

Covering the object with something opaque blocks the light. The spell ends if you cast it again.

Thaumaturgy.name: Thaumaturgy
Thaumaturgy.description:
You manifest a minor wonder within range. You create one of the effects below within range. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its 1-minute effects active at a time.

Altered Eyes. You alter the appearance of your eyes for 1 minute.

Booming Voice. Your voice booms up to three times as loud as normal for 1 minute. For the duration, you have Advantage on [[/check ability=cha skill=itm]] checks.

Fire Play. You cause flames to flicker, brighten, dim, or change color for 1 minute.

Invisible Hand. You instantaneously cause an unlocked door or window to fly open or slam shut.

Phantom Sound. You create an instantaneous sound that originates from a point of your choice within range, such as a rumble of thunder, the cry of a raven, or ominous whispers.

Tremors. You cause harmless tremors in the ground for 1 minute.

Aid.name: Aid
Aid.description:
Choose up to three creatures within range. Each target's Hit Point maximum and current Hit Points increase by 5 for the duration.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. Each target's Hit Points increase by 5 for each spell slot level above 2.

Foundry Note

The default Heal activity is configured with multiple Active Effects representing the temporary maximum Hit Points provided by this spell.

Users should apply the appropriate Active Effect for the spell slot level used in the casting of this spell.

Level 9: +40 Max HP.name: Level 9: +40 Max HP
Level 9: +40 Max HP.description: The target's Hit Point maximum is increased for the duration.

Bless.name: Bless
Bless.description:
You bless up to three creatures within range. Whenever a target makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target adds 1d4 to the attack roll or save.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 1.

Blessed.name: Blessed
Blessed.description: Whenever a target makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target adds 1d4 to the attack roll or save.

Banishment.name: Banishment
Banishment.description:
One creature that you can see within range must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or be transported to a harmless demiplane for the duration. While there, the target has the &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false] condition. When the spell ends, the target reappears in the space it left or in the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied.

If the target is an Aberration, a Celestial, an Elemental, a Fey, or a Fiend, the target doesn't return if the spell lasts for 1 minute. The target is instead transported to a random location on a plane (DM's choice) associated with its creature type.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 4.

Banished.name: Banished
Banished.description:
While there, the target has the &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false] condition. When the spell ends, the target reappears in the space it left or in the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied.

If the target is an Aberration, a Celestial, an Elemental, a Fey, or a Fiend, the target doesn’t return if the spell lasts for 1 minute. The target is instead transported to a random location on a plane (DM’s choice) associated with its creature type.

Flame Strike.name: Flame Strike
Flame Strike.description:
A vertical column of brilliant fire roars down from above. Each creature in a 10-foot-radius, 40-foot-high Cylinder centered on a point within range makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking 5d6 Fire damage and 5d6 Radiant damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The Fire damage and the Radiant damage increase by 1d6 for each spell slot level above 5.

Hold Person.name: Hold Person
Hold Person.description:
Choose a Humanoid that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the &Reference[paralyzed apply=false] condition for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional Humanoid for each spell slot level above 2.

Paralyzed.name: Paralyzed
Paralyzed.description: At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the [[/save ability=wis]] save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Mass Cure Wounds.name: Mass Cure Wounds
Mass Cure Wounds.description:
A wave of healing energy washes out from a point you can see within range. Choose up to six creatures in a 30-foot-radius Sphere centered on that point. Each target regains Hit Points equal to 5d8 plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The healing increases by 1d8 for each spell slot level above 5.

Sending.name: 短讯术
Sending.description:
你向你所遇到过的或某人遇到过且向你描述的一个生物发送一小段二十五个词以内的信息。该生物将在心中听到你的信息，它可以认出你是发讯人（如果他认识你），还可以用同样的方式立即回复一条讯息。法术会让目标能够理解你短讯的信息。

你的传讯可以跨越任意长的距离，甚至能跨越位面。但如果目标和你不在同一个存在位面，则短讯术有 5% 的概率无法到达。如果法术没有到达，你会知晓。

在收到你的信息后，一个生物能够阻塞你在 8 小时内以这个法术对他发信的能力。如果你在这段时间内试图送出另一条信息，你会得知你的短讯被阻塞，并且法术失败。

Commune.name: Commune
Commune.description:
You contact a deity or a divine proxy and ask up to three questions that can be answered with yes or no. You must ask your questions before the spell ends. You receive a correct answer for each question.

Divine beings aren't necessarily omniscient, so you might receive "unclear" as an answer if a question pertains to information that lies beyond the deity's knowledge. In a case where a one-word answer could be misleading or contrary to the deity's interests, the DM might offer a short phrase as an answer instead.

If you cast the spell more than once before finishing a Long Rest, there is a cumulative 25 percent chance for each casting after the first that you get no answer.

Death Ward.name: Death Ward
Death Ward.description:
You touch a creature and grant it a measure of protection from death. The first time the target would drop to 0 Hit Points before the spell ends, the target instead drops to 1 Hit Point, and the spell ends.

If the spell is still in effect when the target is subjected to an effect that would kill it instantly without dealing damage, that effect is negated against the target, and the spell ends.

Protection from Death.name: Protection from Death
Protection from Death.description:
The first time the target would drop to 0 Hit Points before the spell ends, the target instead drops to 1 Hit Point, and the spell ends.

If the spell is still in effect when the target is subjected to an effect that would kill it instantly without dealing damage, that effect is negated against the target, and the spell ends.

Divination.name: Divination
Divination.description:
This spell puts you in contact with a god or a god's servants. You ask one question about a specific goal, event, or activity to occur within 7 days. The DM offers a truthful reply, which might be a short phrase or cryptic rhyme. The spell doesn't account for circumstances that might change the answer, such as the casting of other spells.

If you cast the spell more than once before finishing a Long Rest, there is a cumulative 25 percent chance for each casting after the first that you get no answer.

materials.value: incense worth 25+ GP, which the spell consumes

Scrying.name: 探知术
Scrying.description:
你能看见和听见一个和你处于同一存在位面上的生物。目标生物必须进行一次感知豁免；该豁免的调整值与你对目标的了解程度有关（见下文），也与你和目标之间的物理联系程度有关。目标不知道它进行此豁免在对抗什么，只是会感觉不自在。

你对目标的了解有… 豁免调整值
二手信息（你曾经听说过目标） +5
直接信息（你曾经见过目标） +0
熟悉（你对目标很了解） −5
你持有目标的… 豁免调整值
肖像或其他图像 −2
衣物或其他物品 −4
身体部位如头发或指甲 −10

如果对方豁免成功，则目标不受该法术影响，并且在 24 小时内你不能尝试探知同一个目标。

如果对方豁免失败，则你在目标身边 10 尺内创造出一个隐形的传感器。通过传感器，你可以身临其境地看见和听见周围的环境。传感器会跟随目标移动，并在法术持续时间内始终保持在目标 10 尺之内。在能够看到传感器的生物眼中，你的传感器是一个拳头大小的光球。

除生物之外，你也可以选择一个你以前见过的地点作为该法术的目标。这种情况下，传感器会出现在目标地点且不会移动。

materials.value: 一个至少价值 1000GP 的法器，例如水晶球、银镜、圣水盆

affects.special: 与你处于同一位面的生物，或某个你曾见过的地点的生物
目标身边 10 尺内

Speak with Dead.name: Speak with Dead
Speak with Dead.description:
You grant the semblance of life to a corpse of your choice within range, allowing it to answer questions you pose. The corpse must have a mouth, and this spell fails if the deceased creature was Undead when it died. The spell also fails if the corpse was the target of this spell within the past 10 days.

Until the spell ends, you can ask the corpse up to five questions. The corpse knows only what it knew in life, including the languages it knew. Answers are usually brief, cryptic, or repetitive, and the corpse is under no compulsion to offer a truthful answer if you are antagonistic toward it or it recognizes you as an enemy. This spell doesn't return the creature's soul to its body, only its animating spirit. Thus, the corpse can't learn new information, doesn't comprehend anything that has happened since it died, and can't speculate about future events.

Dispel Magic.name: 解除魔法
Dispel Magic.description:
在施法距离内指定一名生物、一个物件或一处魔法效应。所有影响该目标的三环或更低环阶法术即告终止。每个影响目标的四环或更高环阶法术都需要以你的施法属性进行一次属性检定（DC 10 + 目标法术环阶），检定成功时目标法术终止。

升环施法： 你直接终止影响目标的小于等于该施法环阶的法术效应。

Energy Form.name: Energy Form
Energy Form.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch without expending extra movement to do so, and it can enter a creature's space and stop there. The first time it enters a creature's space on a turn, that creature is moved 20 feet in a random direction.

Incomprehensible Vision.name: Incomprehensible Vision
Incomprehensible Vision.description:
A creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] and can see it is subjected to the following effect. Wisdom Saving Throw: DC 13. Failure: The target has the &reference[Staggered] condition until the start of its next turn. Success: The target is transported to the Border Ethereal. If the target is already on the Border Ethereal, they are transported to the Material Plane instead.

Unless &reference[surprise]{Surprised}, a creature can avert their eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of their turn. If the creature does so, it can't see the [[lookup @name lowercase]] until the start of its next turn. If the creature looks at the [[lookup @name lowercase]] in the meantime, that creature must immediately make the saving throw.

Incomprehensible Vision: Staggered.name: Incomprehensible Vision: Staggered
Incomprehensible Vision: Staggered.description: You are &reference[staggered apply=false] until the start of your next turn.

Shifted: Border Ethereal.name: Shifted: Border Ethereal
Shifted: Border Ethereal.description: You have been transported into the Border Ethereal. If you succeed on the Fractral Lepidoptera's Incomprehensible Vision feature again, you are instead transported to the Material Plane.

Multidimensional Presence.name: Multidimensional Presence
Multidimensional Presence.description: If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] is reduced to 0 Hit Points but hasn't taken damage from a source on both the Material Plane and the Border Ethereal in the last round, it drops to 1 Hit Point instead.

Phototaxis.name: Phototaxis
Phototaxis.description: If a source of Bright Light is within 100 feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]], it attempts to move closer to the light on its turn.

Unraveling Reality.name: Unraveling Reality
Unraveling Reality.description: Charisma Saving Throw: DC 13, each creature in a 60-foot Emanation originating from the [[lookup @name lowercase]] when it dies. Success: The target is transported from the Material Plane to the Border Ethereal, or vice versa.

save.condition: When the Fractal Lepidoptera dies.

Shifted: Border Ethereal.name: Shifted: Border Ethereal
Shifted: Border Ethereal.description: You have been transported into the Border Ethereal. If you succeed on the Fractral Lepidoptera's Incomprehensible Vision feature again, you are instead transported to the Material Plane.

Tessellation.name: Tessellation
Tessellation.description:
Constitution Saving Throw: DC 17, each creature in a 30-foot Emanation originating from the [[lookup @name lowercase]] that doesn't have &reference[TotalCover]. Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target begins its next turn by moving up to its Speed in a random direction.

If the target has the &reference[Staggered apply=false] condition, it instead takes no damage, that condition ends, and the target has the &reference[Incapacitated] condition (save ends). While Incapacitated, the target mutters rhymes in a singsong voice and dances to an unheard rhythm, moving up to its Speed in a random direction at the start of each of its turns.

Tessellated.name: Tessellated
Tessellated.description:
You are &reference[incapacitated apply=false]. You can repeat your saving throw against this effect at the end of each of your turns, ending the effect on a success.

While Incapacitated in this way, you mutter rhymes in a singsong voice and dance to an unheard rhythm, moving up to your Speed in a random direction at the start of each of your turns.

Criss Cross.name: Criss Cross
Criss Cross.description: Trigger: A creature within 60 feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] touches it or hits it with an attack. Response: Charisma Saving Throw: DC 17, the attacker. Failure: The attack deals no damage and the attacker is transported from the Material Plane to the Border Ethereal, or vice versa.

save.condition: When a creature within 60 feet of the lepidoptera touches it or hits it with an attack.

Shifted: Border Ethereal.name: Shifted: Border Ethereal
Shifted: Border Ethereal.description: You have been transported into the Border Ethereal. If you succeed on the Fractral Lepidoptera's Incomprehensible Vision feature again, you are instead transported to the Material Plane.

Aberrant Traits.name: Aberrant Traits
Aberrant Traits.description:
Given the contamination and delerium present within the Space Between Worlds, all creatures who dwell there are the product of contamination and unaffected by the normal dangers of delerium. As an aberrant, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] has the following traits:

  • Fully Contaminated. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] is immune to &reference[drakkenheimContamination] and has Advantage on saving throws against contaminated spells. This creature may cast contaminated spells even though it does not gain Contamination levels.

  • Delerium Healing. As an action, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can touch a delerium shard to regain 10 (3d6) Hit Points. Once the [[lookup @name lowercase]] has used a delerium shard in this way, the shard can't be used in this manner again for 24 hours.

  • Alien Intellect. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] is immune to any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts, as well as any divination spell that it refuses. Wisdom (Insight) checks made to ascertain the [[lookup @name lowercase]]s intentions or sincerity have Disadvantage.

affects.special: a delerium shard

Spell Vessel.name: Spell Vessel
Spell Vessel.description: After using its Consume Spell Reaction, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] stores the spell until the spell is digested or the [[lookup @name lowercase]] dies. When the [[lookup @name lowercase]] dies, the spell takes effect. If the original caster of the spell sees the [[lookup @name lowercase]] die, it can choose the area or target(s) of the spell as if they had cast it from the [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s space. Otherwise, the spell affects a random area or target(s) from those within range.

Warped Space.name: Warped Space
Warped Space.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] magically warps space in a 10-foot Emanation. Attacks targeting the [[lookup @name lowercase]] from outside the Emanation have Disadvantage, and the [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Advantage on saving throws against spells and effects that originate from outside the Emanation.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description:
[[/attack extended]]. Hit: [[/damage 2d6 + 3 piercing average]] damage. If the phage isn’t storing a spell, it makes this attack with Advantage and deals an extra [[/damage average 4d6 piercing]] damage on a hit.

Foundry Note

This attack will automatically deal the additional 14 (4d6) damage if the Phage has the "Stored Spell" active effect applied to it from its @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.monsters.Actor.DrN6baLaKK88mRbH.Item.go3MXS2gHqlZZbPk]{Consume Spell} feature,

Digest Spell.name: Digest Spell
Digest Spell.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] digests the spell it has stored, teleporting to an unoccupied space it can see within 30 feet and making a [[/item qBfbkwanoIUzLKRt]] attack with Advantage.

Consume Spell.name: Consume Spell
Consume Spell.description:
Trigger: A creature within 120 feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts a spell while the [[lookup @name lowercase]] isn’t storing a spell. Response: The spell has no effect and is stored in the [[lookup @name lowercase]].

Foundry Note

Consider renaming the "Stored Spell" active effect to reflect the name of the spell the [[lookup @name lowercase]] has stored to remember the spell when using their @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.monsters.Actor.DrN6baLaKK88mRbH.Item.UyzjhNrA0gQF2Zjt]{Spell Vessel} feature.

utility.condition: When a creature within 120 feet of the Phage casts a spell while the Phage isn't storing a spell.

Stored Spell.name: Stored Spell
Stored Spell.description: The phage is currently storing a spell.

Dispersal.name: Dispersal
Dispersal.description: When the [[lookup @name lowercase]] is reduced to 0 Hit Points, it leaves behind 2d4 @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.monsters.Actor.lswU4nTHwGbM5Goc]{Pilgrims} in its place.

Mob.name: Mob
Mob.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can move through any opening large enough for a Medium Humanoid. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can't regain Hit Points or gain Temporary Hit Points.

Torches.name: Torches
Torches.description: [[/attack extended]]. Hit: The target has the &reference[Burning] condition (4d6 Fire).

Burning (4d6 Fire).name: Burning (4d6 Fire)
Burning (4d6 Fire).description:
You are &reference[burning apply=false] from being covered in fire.

  • At the end of each of your turns, you take [[/damage average fire 4d6]] damage.

  • The condition ends if you or another creature within 5 feet of you spends an action to douse the fire or if some other effect removes it such as submerging yourself in water.

Pitchforks.name: Pitchforks
Pitchforks.description:
[[/attack extended]]. Hit: [[/damage 8d6 piercing]], or [[/damage average 4d6 piercing]] if the [[lookup @name lowercase]] has the &reference[bloodied] condition.

Foundry Note

If the Bloodied condition is enabled in the system settings, the damage of this item will automatically be reduced when below half health.

Trample.name: Trample
Trample.description: Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 16, one creature in the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s space that has the &reference[Prone apply=false] condition. Failure: [[/damage average]] damage. Success: Half damage.

affects.special: A creature that is Prone in the congregation's space.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes one attack against each creature in its space.

False Appearance.name: False Appearance
False Appearance.description: While the [[lookup @name lowercase]] remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a gigantic mushroom.

Regeneration.name: Regeneration
Regeneration.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] regains 30 Hit Points at the start of each of its turns. If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes Acid or Fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s next turn. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] dies only if it starts its turn with 0 Hit Points and doesn't regenerate.

Rotting Aura.name: Rotting Aura
Rotting Aura.description: Any creature who starts its turn in a 30-foot Emanation originating from the [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes [[/damage average]] damage unless the [[lookup @name lowercase]] has the &reference[Incapacitated apply=false] condition.

Grasping Tendrils.name: Grasping Tendrils
Grasping Tendrils.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]], and if the target is Huge or smaller, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] pulls the target up to 20 feet straight towards itself.

Entangling Mycelia.name: Entangling Mycelia
Entangling Mycelia.description:
Strength Saving Throw: DC 15, each creature of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]s choice in a 30-foot radius centered on it. Failure: The target has the &reference[Restrained] condition (save ends).

When the [[lookup @name lowercase]] becomes &reference[bloodied], they regain a use of this Epic Action.

Recharge Epic Action (When Bloodied).name: Recharge Epic Action (When Bloodied)
Recharge Epic Action (When Bloodied).condition: When the humongous fungus troll is bloodied

Entangling Mycelia.name: Entangling Mycelia
Entangling Mycelia.description: You are &reference[restrained apply=false]. You can repeat your saving throw against this effect at the end of each of your turns, ending the effect on a success.

Spawn Trolling.name: Spawn Trolling
Spawn Trolling.description: The troll creates a @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.monsters.Actor.kMue3OQFZtzXtzni] which appears in an unoccupied space within 10 feet of it. The fungal trolling acts immediately after the [[lookup @name lowercase]] uses this action, then acts after the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s turn on subsequent rounds.

Epic Boss.name: Epic Boss
Epic Boss.description:
This creature is an Epic Boss, a unique foe designed to pose a solo threat to an entire adventuring party. As such, it has additional game rules that sets it apart from normal creatures:

The [[lookup @name lowercase]] always takes their turn on Initiative count 20. On their turn, they can use their movement and interaction as normal. However, they do not take an action or Bonus Action on their turn unless forced to do so by a spell or other effect. Instead, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes one of the following Epic Actions at the end of each player character's turn.

All this creature's actions are Epic Actions.

  • @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.monsters.Actor.DxRms9It18hCd2Ug.Item.bGfRDJM3rR1sAoJ1]{Spore Slam}

  • @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.monsters.Actor.DxRms9It18hCd2Ug.Item.sO7ivm0HgxxY8L0v]{Grasping Tendrils}

  • @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.monsters.Actor.DxRms9It18hCd2Ug.Item.zR9GukN94sqolEkG]{Entangling Mycelia}

  • @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.monsters.Actor.DxRms9It18hCd2Ug.Item.xS0kiOcSVzR4WZYN]{Spawn Trolling}

  • @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.monsters.Actor.DxRms9It18hCd2Ug.Item.sfiJiDdbwF6SAUdL]{Epic Resistance}

Epic Boss.name: Epic Boss
Epic Boss.description:
This creature is an Epic Boss, a unique foe designed to pose a solo threat to an entire adventuring party. As such, it has additional game rules that sets it apart from normal creatures.

The creature always takes their turn on Initiative count 20. On their turn, they can use their movement and interaction as normal. However, they do not take an action or Bonus Action on their turn unless forced to do so by a spell or other effect. Instead, the creature takes one of the Epic Actions they have available.

Epic Resistance.name: Epic Resistance
Epic Resistance.description: [[lookup @name]] chooses one condition, spell, or other effect currently affecting them and rolls [[/r 1d20]]. On an 11 or higher, the effect ends on them. [[lookup @name]] can use this Epic Action even if they would otherwise be unable to take actions, their actions are being controlled by another creature, or if a spell or effect alters their game statistics.

Cunning Action.name: Cunning Action
Cunning Action.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

Detect Magic.name: Detect Magic
Detect Magic.description:
For the duration, you sense the presence of magical effects within 30 feet of yourself. If you sense such effects, you can take the Magic action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears the magic, and if an effect was created by a spell, you learn the spell's school of magic.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Mage Armor.name: Mage Armor
Mage Armor.description: You touch a willing creature who isn't wearing armor. Until the spell ends, the target's base AC becomes 13 plus its Dexterity modifier. The spell ends early if the target dons armor.

Mage Armor.name: Mage Armor
Mage Armor.description: The target's base AC becomes 13 + its Dexterity modifier.

Mage Hand.name: 法师之手
Mage Hand.description:
A spectral, floating hand appears at a point you choose within range. The hand lasts for the duration. The hand vanishes if it is ever more than 30 feet away from you or if you cast this spell again.

When you cast the spell, you can use the hand to manipulate an object, open an unlocked door or container, stow or retrieve an item from an open container, or pour the contents out of a vial.

As a Magic action on your later turns, you can control the hand thus again. As part of that action, you can move the hand up to 30 feet.

The hand can't attack, activate magic items, or carry more than 10 pounds.

Minor Illusion.name: Minor Illusion
Minor Illusion.description:
You create a sound or an image of an object within range that lasts for the duration. See the descriptions below for the effects of each. The illusion ends if you cast this spell again.

If a creature takes a Study action to examine the sound or image, the creature can determine that it is an illusion with a successful [[/check ability=int skill=inv dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the illusion becomes faint to the creature.

Sound. If you create a sound, its volume can range from a whisper to a scream. It can be your voice, someone else's voice, a lion's roar, a beating of drums, or any other sound you choose. The sound continues unabated throughout the duration, or you can make discrete sounds at different times before the spell ends.

Image. If you create an image of an object—such as a chair, muddy footprints, or a small chest—it must be no larger than a 5-foot Cube. The image can't create sound, light, smell, or any other sensory effect. Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion, since things can pass through it.

Prestidigitation.name: 魔法伎俩
Prestidigitation.description:
你在施法距离内创造一个魔法效应。从下述效应中选择一项。如果你多次施展该法术，则可以同时维持至多三个不同的非即时效应。

感官效应。 你创造一个立即生效的，无害的感官效应，比如一束火花，一阵风，微弱音乐或古怪的臭味。

玩火。你立即点亮或熄灭一根蜡烛、一根火把或一处小篝火。

清洁或弄脏。 你立即清洁或弄脏一个不大于 1 立方尺的物件。

次级感官。 你使一个不大于 1 立方尺的无生命物质变冷、变暖或对其调味，持续 1 小时。

魔法印记。 你在一个物件或一个表面上创造一块色斑，一个小印记，或者一个徽记，持续 1 小时。

次级造物。 你创造出一个非魔法小饰品或一张虚幻图像，其大小不能超过你的手掌大小，它会持续存在至下个你的回合结束为止。一个小饰品不能造成伤害，也不值钱。

Disguise Self.name: Disguise Self
Disguise Self.description:
You make yourself—including your clothing, armor, weapons, and other belongings on your person—look different until the spell ends. You can seem 1 foot shorter or taller and can appear heavier or lighter. You must adopt a form that has the same basic arrangement of limbs as you have. Otherwise, the extent of the illusion is up to you.

The changes wrought by this spell fail to hold up to physical inspection. For example, if you use this spell to add a hat to your outfit, objects pass through the hat, and anyone who touches it would feel nothing.

To discern that you are disguised, a creature must take the Study action to inspect your appearance and succeed on an [[/check ability=int skill=inv dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC.

Disguised.name: Disguised
Disguised.description: To discern that you are disguised, a creature must take the Study action to inspect your appearance and succeed on an [[/check ability=int skill=inv]] check against your spell save DC.

Invisibility.name: Invisibility
Invisibility.description:
A creature you touch has the &Reference[invisible apply=false] condition until the spell ends. The spell ends early immediately after the target makes an attack roll, deals damage, or casts a spell.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 2.

Invisible.name: 隐形
Invisible.description: 如果你进行攻击检定、造成伤害或施展法术，则该法术提前终止。

Mirror Image.name: Mirror Image
Mirror Image.description:
Three illusory duplicates of yourself appear in your space. Until the spell ends, the duplicates move with you and mimic your actions, shifting position so it's impossible to track which image is real.

Each time a creature hits you with an attack roll during the spell's duration, roll a [[/r (@flags.dnd-players-handbook.mirrorImages)d6kh1cs>2#Duplicate destroyed]]{d6 for each} of your remaining duplicates. If any of the d6s rolls a 3 or higher, one of the duplicates is hit instead of you, and the duplicate is destroyed. The duplicates otherwise ignore all other damage and effects. The spell ends when all three duplicates are destroyed.

A creature is unaffected by this spell if it has the &Reference[blinded apply=false] condition, &Reference[blindsight], or &Reference[truesight].

Sleep.name: Sleep
Sleep.description:
Each creature of your choice in a 5-foot-radius Sphere centered on a point within range must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the &Reference[incapacitated apply=false] condition until the end of its next turn, at which point it must repeat the save. If the target fails the second save, the target has the &Reference[unconscious] condition for the duration. The spell ends on a target if it takes damage or someone within 5 feet of it takes an action to shake it out of the spell's effect.

Creatures that don't sleep, such as elves, or that have Immunity to the Exhaustion condition automatically succeed on saves against this spell.

materials.value: a pinch of sand or rose petals

Sleeping.name: Sleeping
Sleeping.description: The target has the &Reference[incapacitated apply=false] condition until the end of its next turn, at which point it must repeat the save. If the target fails the second save, the target has the &Reference[unconscious] condition for the duration. The spell ends on a target if it takes damage or someone within 5 feet of it takes an action to shake it out of the spell’s effect.

Suggestion.name: Suggestion
Suggestion.description:
You suggest a course of activity—described in no more than 25 words—to one creature you can see within range that can hear and understand you. The suggestion must sound achievable and not involve anything that would obviously deal damage to the target or its allies. For example, you could say, "Fetch the key to the cult's treasure vault, and give the key to me." Or you could say, "Stop fighting, leave this library peacefully, and don't return."

The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the Charmed condition for the duration or until you or your allies deal damage to the target. The Charmed target pursues the suggestion to the best of its ability. The suggested activity can continue for the entire duration, but if the suggested activity can be completed in a shorter time, the spell ends for the target upon completing it.

Pursuing Suggestion.name: Pursuing Suggestion
Pursuing Suggestion.description: The Charmed target pursues the suggestion to the best of its ability. The suggested activity can continue for the entire duration, but if the suggested activity can be completed in a shorter time, the spell ends for the target upon completing it.

Dominate Person.name: Dominate Person
Dominate Person.description:
One Humanoid you can see within range must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the &Reference[Charmed apply=false] condition for the duration. The target has Advantage on the save if you or your allies are fighting it. Whenever the target takes damage, it repeats the save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

You have a telepathic link with the Charmed target while the two of you are on the same plane of existence. On your turn, you can use this link to issue commands to the target (no action required), such as "Attack that creature," "Move over there," or "Fetch that object." The target does its best to obey on its turn. If it completes an order and doesn't receive further direction from you, it acts and moves as it likes, focusing on protecting itself.

You can command the target to take a Reaction but must take your own Reaction to do so.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. Your Concentration can last longer with a spell slot of level 6 (up to 10 minutes), 7 (up to 1 hour), or 8+ (up to 8 hours).

Dominated.name: Dominated
Dominated.description: Whenever the &Reference[charmed apply=false] target takes damage, it repeats the [[/save ability=wis]] save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Gaseous Form.name: Gaseous Form
Gaseous Form.description:
A willing creature you touch shape-shifts, along with everything it's wearing and carrying, into a misty cloud for the duration. The spell ends on the target if it drops to 0 Hit Points or if it takes a Magic action to end the spell on itself.

While in this form, the target's only method of movement is a Fly Speed of 10 feet, and it can hover. The target can enter and occupy the space of another creature. The target has Resistance to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage; it has Immunity to the &Reference[prone apply=false] condition; and it has Advantage on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws. The target can pass through narrow openings, but it treats liquids as though they were solid surfaces.

The target can't talk or manipulate objects, and any objects it was carrying or holding can't be dropped, used, or otherwise interacted with. Finally, the target can't attack or cast spells.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 3.

Gaseous Form.name: Gaseous Form
Gaseous Form.description:
The target’s only method of movement is a Fly Speed of 10 feet, and it can hover. The target can enter and occupy the space of another creature. The target has Resistance to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage; it has Immunity to the &Reference[prone apply=false] condition; and it has Advantage on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws. The target can pass through narrow openings, but it treats liquids as though they were solid surfaces.

The target can’t talk or manipulate objects, and any objects it was carrying or holding can’t be dropped, used, or otherwise interacted with. Finally, the target can’t attack or cast spells.

Hypnotic Pattern.name: Hypnotic Pattern
Hypnotic Pattern.description:
You create a twisting pattern of colors in a 30-foot Cube within range. The pattern appears for a moment and vanishes. Each creature in the area who can see the pattern must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the &Reference[charmed apply=false] condition for the duration. While Charmed, the creature has the &Reference[incapacitated apply=false] condition and a Speed of 0.

The spell ends for an affected creature if it takes any damage or if someone else uses an action to shake the creature out of its stupor.

Hypnotized.name: Hypnotized
Hypnotized.description:
While &Reference[charmed apply=false], the creature has the &Reference[incapacitated apply=false] condition and a Speed of 0.

The spell ends for an affected creature if it takes any damage or if someone else uses an action to shake the creature out of its stupor.

Mage Armor.name: Mage Armor
Mage Armor.description: The target's base AC becomes 13 + its Dexterity modifier.

Claw.name: Claw
Claw.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]]. If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] flies 30+ feet straight toward the target immediately before the hit, the target has the &reference[Prone] condition and the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can make a [[/item TyJzm6uZNQ0ksoVT]] attack against it as a Bonus Action.

Stinger.name: Stinger
Stinger.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]]. Constitution Saving Throw: DC 15. Failure: [[/damage average]] damage. Failure by 5 or More: The target also gains one &reference[drakkenheimContamination] level. Success: Half damage only.

Wing Shards.name: Wing Shards
Wing Shards.description: Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 15, each creature in a 20-foot Emanation originating from the [[lookup @name lowercase]] (flying creatures have Disadvantage). Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and if the target is flying, it has the &reference[Prone] condition. Success: Half damage only.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item .ib51wF1e5euO9TFU]] attacks and one [[/item .emhCakC2gMoG0OJG]] attack.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average]].

Hazardous Fumes.name: Hazardous Fumes
Hazardous Fumes.description: A creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] has the &reference[Burning] condition (4d4 Acid). While Burning, the creature also has the &reference[Slowed] condition. While the creature remains within 10 feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]], the Burning condition cannot be removed in any way.

Burning (4d4 Acid).name: Burning (4d4 Acid)
Burning (4d4 Acid).description:
You are &reference[burning apply=false] from being covered in acid.

  • At the end of each of your turns, you take [[/damage average acid 4d4]] damage.

  • The condition ends if you or another creature within 5 feet of you spends an action to scrape off the acid or if some other effect removes it.

While Burning in this way, you are also &reference[slowed apply=false]. You cannot end the burning condition in any way while within 10 feet of the living biohazard.

Liquid Form.name: Liquid Form
Liquid Form.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can squeeze through a space as narrow as 1 inch, and can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. The first time it enters a creature's space on a turn, that creature takes [[/damage average]] damage. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Advantage on ability checks it makes to initiate or escape a grapple.

Spider Climb.name: Spider Climb
Spider Climb.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

Blood Howl.name: Blood Howl
Blood Howl.description: Wisdom Saving Throw: DC 18, each creature in a 30-foot Emanation originating from the [[lookup @name lowercase]] that can hear it. Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &reference[Jinxed] (1d6) and &reference[Immobilized] conditions (save ends both). Success: Half damage, and the target is immune to the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s [[lookup @item.name]] for 24 hours.

Jinxed (1d6).name: Jinxed (1d6)
Jinxed (1d6).description:
You subtract 1d6 to your attack rolls and saving throws. You can repeat your saving throw against this effect at the end of each of your turns, ending the effect on a success.

While Jinxed in this way, you are also &reference[Immobilized apply=false].

Charge.name: Charge
Charge.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] moves up to 40 feet in a straight line, moving through the spaces of other creatures. Each creature whose space the [[lookup @name lowercase]] passes through is subjected to the following effect. Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 18. Failure: The target is pushed 10 feet away from the [[lookup @name lowercase]] and has the &reference[Prone] condition.

affects.special: Any creature in the striga's path when they charge.

Retaliation.name: Retaliation
Retaliation.description: Trigger: A creature within 15 feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] deals Radiant damage to it. Response: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes a [[/item mzMcExuBg4LVsQyy]] attack against that creature.

utility.condition: When a creature within 15 feet of the striga deals radiant damage to it.

Blood Frenzy.name: Blood Frenzy
Blood Frenzy.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Advantage on melee attack rolls against a creature with the &reference[Bloodied] condition.

Fully Contaminated.name: Fully Contaminated
Fully Contaminated.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] is immune to &reference[drakkenheimContamination] and has Advantage on saving throws against contaminated spells. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] may cast contaminated spells even though it does not gain Contamination levels.

Spider Climb.name: Spider Climb
Spider Climb.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

Vampire Weaknesses.name: Vampire Weaknesses
Vampire Weaknesses.description:
As a vampire, this creature has the following weaknesses:

  • Forbiddance. The vampire can't enter a residence without an invitation from one of the occupants.

  • Harmed by Running Water. The vampire takes [[/damage activity=TXfKdpwrbcIMoY3l]] damage when it ends its turn in running water.

  • Stake to the Heart. If a Piercing weapon made of wood is driven into the vampire's heart while the vampire is Incapacitated in its resting place, the vampire is Paralyzed until the stake is removed.

  • Sunlight Hypersensitivity. The vampire takes [[/damage activity=agngcqt5cICRvCaw]] damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has Disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

Running Water.name: Running Water
Running Water.condition: If the vampire ends their turn in running water.

Epic Boss.name: Epic Boss
Epic Boss.description:
This creature is an Epic Boss, a unique foe designed to pose a solo threat to an entire adventuring party. As such, it has additional game rules that sets it apart from normal creatures:

[[lookup @name]] always takes their turn on Initiative count 20. On their turn, they can use their movement and interaction as normal. However, they do not take an action or Bonus Action on their turn unless forced to do so by a spell or other effect. Instead, [[lookup @name]] takes one of the following Epic Actions at the end of each player character's turn.

All this creature's actions are Epic Actions.

Epic Boss.name: Epic Boss
Epic Boss.description:
This creature is an Epic Boss, a unique foe designed to pose a solo threat to an entire adventuring party. As such, it has additional game rules that sets it apart from normal creatures.

The creature always takes their turn on Initiative count 20. On their turn, they can use their movement and interaction as normal. However, they do not take an action or Bonus Action on their turn unless forced to do so by a spell or other effect. Instead, the creature takes one of the Epic Actions they have available.

Epic Resistance.name: Epic Resistance
Epic Resistance.description: [[lookup @name]] chooses one condition, spell, or other effect currently affecting them and rolls [[/r 1d20]]. On an 11 or higher, the effect ends on them. [[lookup @name]] can use this Epic Action even if they would otherwise be unable to take actions, their actions are being controlled by another creature, or if a spell or effect alters their game statistics.

Delerium Healing.name: Delerium Healing
Delerium Healing.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] touches a delerium shard and regains 10 (3d6) Hit Points. Once the [[lookup @name lowercase]] has used a delerium shard in this way, it can't be used in this manner again for 24 hours.

affects.special: a delerium shard

Necrotic Aura.name: Necrotic Aura
Necrotic Aura.description: A creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes [[/damage average]] damage.

Necrotic Bite.name: Necrotic Bite
Necrotic Bite.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]]. The target’s Hit Point Maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the Necrotic damage taken, and the [[lookup @name lowercase]] regains Hit Points equal to that amount.

Regeneration.name: Regeneration
Regeneration.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] regains 10 Hit Points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 Hit Point and isn't in sunlight or running water. If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes Radiant damage or damage from holy water, this trait doesn't function at the start of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s next turn.

Amorphous Form.name: Amorphous Form
Amorphous Form.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch without squeezing

Crush and Consume.name: Crush and Consume
Crush and Consume.description: Strength Saving Throw: DC 12, one creature &reference[Grappled apply=false] by the [[lookup @name lowercase]]. Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the [[lookup @name lowercase]] regains an equal number of Hit Points. If this damage kills the target, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] assumes its form. The [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s game statistics are the same in each form. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

affects.special: A creature grappled by the skin crawler.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item N6ul3uCqw8GfjSp0]] attacks and one [[/item ovaLw33neoQaL7PZ]] attack.

Bind.name: Bind
Bind.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]], and if the target is Medium or smaller, it has the &reference[Grappled] condition (escape DC 12). While Grappled, the target has the &reference[Restrained] condition and Disadvantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws, and the skin crawler can't Bind another target.

Grappled by Skin Crawler.name: Grappled by Skin Crawler
Grappled by Skin Crawler.description: You are &reference[grappled apply=false] (escape DC 12). While grappled in this way, you are also &reference[restrained apply=false].

Swarm.name: Swarm
Swarm.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can move through an opening large enough for a Small creature. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can't regain Hit Points or gain Temporary Hit Points.

Hurl Ratling.name: Hurl Ratling
Hurl Ratling.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] picks up a willing Medium or smaller ratling ally or corpse within 5 feet. Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 14, one creature the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within 30 feet. Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &reference[Prone] condition. Success: Half damage only. Failure or Success: The hurled ratling takes the same damage and lands with the &reference[Prone] condition.

Enrage.name: Enrage
Enrage.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] gains 15 Temporary Hit Points. Until the Temporary Hit Points are lost, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Advantage on Strength-based D20 Tests.

Enraged.name: Enraged
Enraged.description: The giant ratling has Advantage on all Strength-based D20 tests while they possess temporary hit points from their Enrage feature.

Keen Smell.name: Keen Smell
Keen Smell.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item oYmgJEsRWg2MqK32]] attacks and one [[/item 6JItHM4jyd8mGp7R]] attack. It can replace up to two attacks with uses of [[/item K1e8gJbWklxNFsAw]].

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]].

Claw.name: Claw
Claw.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]]. Critical Hit: The target has the &reference[Staggered] condition until the start of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s next turn.

Claw Stagger.name: Claw Stagger
Claw Stagger.description: You are &reference[staggered apply=false] until the start of the giant ratling's next turn,

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item .Y1FNgJGbua7BOvIO]] attacks and uses [[/item .YHGD3Npws7WOpqCl]].

Loathsome Presence.name: Loathsome Presence
Loathsome Presence.description: Wisdom Saving Throw: DC 15, each creature that can see the [[lookup @name lowercase]]. Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &reference[Frightened] condition for 1 minute (save ends). If the creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, it is immune to the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s Loathsome Presence for 24 hours.

affects.special: Creatures that can see the kronen.

Infestation.name: Infestation
Infestation.description: Trigger: A creature ends its turn within 5 feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]. Response: Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 15. Failure: The target is covered in cockroaches. It takes [[/damage average]] damage at the end of each of its turns until a creature takes an action to swipe the cockroaches off its body.

save.condition: When a creature ends their turn within 5 feet of the kronen.

Quarry.name: Quarry
Quarry.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplHuntersMar]{Hunter's Mark}, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability.

Longbow.name: Longbow
Longbow.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]], and the target has the &reference[slowed] condition until the end of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s next turn.

Slowing Shot.name: Slowing Shot
Slowing Shot.description: You are &reference[slowed apply=false] until the end of the hooded lantern scout's next turn.

Arrows.name: Arrows
Arrows.description:
Storage: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagQuiver00000]{Quiver}

@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagAmmunitionV]{Ammunition} is required by a weapon that has the Ammunition property. A weapon's description specifies the type of ammunition used by the weapon. The Ammunition table lists the different types and the amount you get when you buy them. The table also lists the item that is typically used to store each type; storage must be bought separately.

Hunter's Mark.name: Hunter's Mark
Hunter's Mark.description:
You magically mark one creature you can see within range as your quarry. Until the spell ends, you deal an extra 1d6 Force damage to the target whenever you hit it with an attack roll. You also have Advantage on any [[/check ability=wis skill=prc]] or [[/check ability=wis skill=sur]] check you make to find it.

If the target drops to 0 Hit Points before this spell ends, you can take a Bonus Action to move the mark to a new creature you can see within range.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. Your Concentration can last longer with a spell slot of level 3–4 (up to 8 hours) or 5+ (up to 24 hours).

Death Strike.name: Death Strike
Death Strike.description: When the [[lookup @name lowercase]] reduces a creature to 0 Hit Points, the creature immediately dies.

Poisoned Weapon.name: Poisoned Weapon
Poisoned Weapon.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]]. Once per turn, the assassin can apply one of the following addition al effects to the target:

  • Silent Scream. Intelligence Saving Throw: DC 16. Failure: The target has the &reference[Bewildered] condition (save ends). While Bewildered, the target is unable to speak.

  • Sap Strength. Constitution Saving Throw: DC 16. Failure: The target has the &reference[Poisoned] condition (save ends). While Poisoned, the target also has the &reference[Weakened] condition.

  • Sluggish Sinews. Strength Saving Throw: DC 16. Failure: The target has the &reference[Dazed] condition (save ends). While Dazed, the target also has the &reference[Slowed] condition.

Silent Scream.name: Silent Scream
Silent Scream.description:
You are &reference[bewildered apply=false]. You can repeat your saving throw against this effect at the end of each of your turns, ending the effect on a success.

While Bewildered in this way, you are unable to speak.

Sapped Strength.name: Sapped Strength
Sapped Strength.description:
You are &reference[poisoned apply=false]. You can repeat your saving throw against this effect at the end of each of your turns, ending the effect on a success.

While Poisoned in this way, you are also &reference[weakened apply=false].

Sluggish Sinews.name: Sluggish Sinews
Sluggish Sinews.description:
You are &reference[Dazed apply=false]. You can repeat your saving throw against this effect at the end of each of your turns, ending the effect on a success.

While Dazed in this way, you are also &reference[slowed apply=false].

Cunning Action.name: Cunning Action
Cunning Action.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

Disturbing Bleating.name: Disturbing Bleating
Disturbing Bleating.description: A creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] is subjected to the following effect. Wisdom Saving Throw: DC 14. Failure: The target has the &reference[Staggered] condition until the start of its next turn. Success: The target is immune to the Disturbing Bleating of all [[lookup @name lowercase]]s for 24 hours.

Disturbing Bleating.name: Disturbing Bleating
Disturbing Bleating.description: You are &reference[staggered apply=false] until the start of your next turn.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes one [[/item KhX6WHzDfbZTrHJi]] attack and one [[/item Nkz02A9gbJdbR3oY]] attack.

Pack Tactics.name: Pack Tactics
Pack Tactics.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally doesn't have the &reference[Incapacitated apply=false] condition.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]].

Holy Weapons.name: Holy Weapons
Holy Weapons.description: When the [[lookup @name lowercase]] hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 9 (2d8) Radiant damage (included in the attack).

Deny the Witch.name: Deny the Witch
Deny the Witch.description: Trigger: A creature the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within 60 feet casts a spell. Response: If the spell is level 3 or lower, the spell fails, but no resources are wasted.

utility.condition: When a creature the paladin can see within 60 feet casts a spell.

Lay on Hands.name: Lay on Hands
Lay on Hands.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] touches another creature. The target regains 11 (2d8 + 2) Hit Points and is cured of one disease or the Poisoned condition.

Blood Drain.name: Blood Drain
Blood Drain.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]], and the [[lookup @name lowercase]] regains Hit Points equal to the damage dealt. The target has the &reference[Weakened] condition (DC 15 Constitution save ends).

Blood Drained.name: Blood Drained
Blood Drained.description: You are &reference[weakened apply=false]. You can make a [[/save 15 con]] saving throw against this effect at the end of each of your turns, ending the effect on a success.

Feast.name: Feast
Feast.description: Wisdom Saving Throw: DC 15, each creature in a 30-foot Emanation originating from the [[lookup @name lowercase]]. Failure: [[/damage average]] damage. Success: Half damage. Failure or Success: The vampire regains Hit Points equal to the Necrotic damage dealt.

Arcane Denial.name: Arcane Denial
Arcane Denial.description: Trigger: A creature the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within 60 feet casts a spell of level 3 or lower. Response: Constitution Saving Throw: DC 15. Failure: The spell fails, but no resources are wasted.

save.condition: When a creature the sanguine witch can see within 60 feet casts a spell of level 3 or level.

Vampire Weaknesses.name: Vampire Weaknesses
Vampire Weaknesses.description:
As a vampire, this creature has the following weaknesses:

  • Forbiddance. The vampire can't enter a residence without an invitation from one of the occupants.

  • Harmed by Running Water. The vampire takes [[/damage activity=TXfKdpwrbcIMoY3l]] damage when it ends its turn in running water.

  • Stake to the Heart. If a Piercing weapon made of wood is driven into the vampire's heart while the vampire is Incapacitated in its resting place, the vampire is Paralyzed until the stake is removed.

  • Sunlight Hypersensitivity. The vampire takes [[/damage activity=agngcqt5cICRvCaw]] damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has Disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

Running Water.name: Running Water
Running Water.condition: If the vampire ends their turn in running water.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two attacks and uses [[/item r52mPfzxcnCUBehg]], if available. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting.

Spider Climb.name: Spider Climb
Spider Climb.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

Mage Armor.name: Mage Armor
Mage Armor.description: You touch a willing creature who isn't wearing armor. Until the spell ends, the target's base AC becomes 13 plus its Dexterity modifier. The spell ends early if the target dons armor.

Mage Armor.name: Mage Armor
Mage Armor.description: The target's base AC becomes 13 + its Dexterity modifier.

Darkness.name: Darkness
Darkness.description:
For the duration, magical &Reference[darkness] spreads from a point within range and fills a 15-foot-radius Sphere. Darkvision can't see through it, and nonmagical light can't illuminate it.

Alternatively, you cast the spell on an object that isn't being worn or carried, causing the Darkness to fill a 15-foot Emanation originating from that object. Covering that object with something opaque, such as a bowl or helm, blocks the Darkness.

If any of this spell's area overlaps with an area of Bright Light or Dim Light created by a spell of level 2 or lower, that other spell is dispelled.

materials.value: bat fur and a piece of coal

Fear.name: Fear
Fear.description:
Each creature in a 30-foot Cone must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or drop whatever it is holding and have the &Reference[frightened apply=false] condition for the duration.

A Frightened creature takes the &Reference[dash] action and moves away from you by the safest route on each of its turns unless there is nowhere to move. If the creature ends its turn in a space where it doesn't have line of sight to you, the creature makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a successful save, the spell ends on that creature.

Fear.name: Fear
Fear.description: A &Reference[frightened apply=false] creature takes the &Reference[dash] action and moves away from you by the safest route on each of its turns unless there is nowhere to move. If the creature ends its turn in a space where it doesn’t have line of sight to you, the creature makes a [[/save ability=wis]] saving throw. On a successful save, the spell ends on that creature.

Hold Person.name: Hold Person
Hold Person.description:
Choose a Humanoid that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the &Reference[paralyzed apply=false] condition for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional Humanoid for each spell slot level above 2.

Paralyzed.name: Paralyzed
Paralyzed.description: At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the [[/save ability=wis]] save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Inflict Wounds.name: Inflict Wounds
Inflict Wounds.description:
A creature you touch makes a Constitution saving throw, taking 2d10 Necrotic damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d10 for each spell slot level above 1.

Ray of Enfeeblement.name: Ray of Enfeeblement
Ray of Enfeeblement.description:
A beam of enervating energy shoots from you toward a creature within range. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a successful save, the target has Disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes until the start of your next turn.

On a failed save, the target has Disadvantage on Strength-based D20 Tests for the duration. During that time, it also subtracts 1d8 from all its damage rolls. The target repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the spell on a success.

Brief Enfeeblement.name: Brief Enfeeblement
Brief Enfeeblement.description: The target has Disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes until the start of your next turn.

Enervated.name: Enervated
Enervated.description: The target has Disadvantage on Strength-based D20 Tests for the duration. During that time, it also subtracts 1d8 from all its damage rolls. The target repeats the [[/save ability=con]] save at the end of each of its turns, ending the spell on a success.

Suggestion.name: Suggestion
Suggestion.description:
You suggest a course of activity—described in no more than 25 words—to one creature you can see within range that can hear and understand you. The suggestion must sound achievable and not involve anything that would obviously deal damage to the target or its allies. For example, you could say, "Fetch the key to the cult's treasure vault, and give the key to me." Or you could say, "Stop fighting, leave this library peacefully, and don't return."

The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the Charmed condition for the duration or until you or your allies deal damage to the target. The Charmed target pursues the suggestion to the best of its ability. The suggested activity can continue for the entire duration, but if the suggested activity can be completed in a shorter time, the spell ends for the target upon completing it.

Pursuing Suggestion.name: Pursuing Suggestion
Pursuing Suggestion.description: The Charmed target pursues the suggestion to the best of its ability. The suggested activity can continue for the entire duration, but if the suggested activity can be completed in a shorter time, the spell ends for the target upon completing it.

Bestow Curse.name: Bestow Curse
Bestow Curse.description:
You touch a creature, which must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become cursed for the duration. Until the curse ends, the target suffers one of the following effects of your choice:

  • Choose one ability. The target has Disadvantage on ability checks and saving throws made with that ability (Curse Ability activity).
  • The target has Disadvantage on attack rolls against you (Curse Attacks activity).
  • In combat, the target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw at the start of each of its turns or be forced to take the &Reference[Dodge] action on that turn (Curse Actions activity).
  • If you deal damage to the target with an attack roll or a spell, the target takes an extra 1d8 Necrotic damage (Curse Resilience activity).

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. If you cast this spell using a level 4 spell slot, you can maintain Concentration on it for up to 10 minutes. If you use a level 5+ spell slot, the spell doesn't require Concentration, and the duration becomes 8 hours (level 5–6 slot) or 24 hours (level 7–8 slot). If you use a level 9 spell slot, the spell lasts until dispelled.

Cursed Charisma.name: Cursed Charisma
Cursed Charisma.description: The target has Disadvantage on ability checks and saving throws made with the chosen ability.

Cursed Constitution.name: Cursed Constitution
Cursed Constitution.description: The target has Disadvantage on ability checks and saving throws made with the chosen ability.

Cursed Dexterity.name: Cursed Dexterity
Cursed Dexterity.description: The target has Disadvantage on ability checks and saving throws made with the chosen ability.

Cursed Intelligence.name: Cursed Intelligence
Cursed Intelligence.description: The target has Disadvantage on ability checks and saving throws made with the chosen ability.

Cursed Strength.name: Cursed Strength
Cursed Strength.description: The target has Disadvantage on ability checks and saving throws made with the chosen ability.

Cursed Wisdom.name: Cursed Wisdom
Cursed Wisdom.description: The target has Disadvantage on ability checks and saving throws made with the chosen ability.

Cursed Attacks.name: Cursed Attacks
Cursed Attacks.description: The target has Disadvantage on attack rolls against you.

Cursed Actions.name: Cursed Actions
Cursed Actions.description: In combat, the target must succeed on a [[/save ability=wis dc=@attributes.spell.dc format=long]] at the start of each of its turns or be forced to take the &Reference[Dodge] action on that turn.

Cursed Resilience.name: Cursed Resilience
Cursed Resilience.description: If you deal damage to the target with an attack roll or a spell, the target takes an extra [[/damage 1d8 type=necrotic]] damage.

Dominate Person.name: Dominate Person
Dominate Person.description:
One Humanoid you can see within range must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the &Reference[Charmed apply=false] condition for the duration. The target has Advantage on the save if you or your allies are fighting it. Whenever the target takes damage, it repeats the save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

You have a telepathic link with the Charmed target while the two of you are on the same plane of existence. On your turn, you can use this link to issue commands to the target (no action required), such as "Attack that creature," "Move over there," or "Fetch that object." The target does its best to obey on its turn. If it completes an order and doesn't receive further direction from you, it acts and moves as it likes, focusing on protecting itself.

You can command the target to take a Reaction but must take your own Reaction to do so.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. Your Concentration can last longer with a spell slot of level 6 (up to 10 minutes), 7 (up to 1 hour), or 8+ (up to 8 hours).

Dominated.name: Dominated
Dominated.description: Whenever the &Reference[charmed apply=false] target takes damage, it repeats the [[/save ability=wis]] save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Hypnotic Pattern.name: Hypnotic Pattern
Hypnotic Pattern.description:
