The [[lookup @name lowercase]] creates a 10-foot radius Sphere of psychoactive fog centered on a point it can see within 60 feet. The fog spreads around corners and renders its area &reference[HeavilyObscured]. It lasts for 1 minute or until a strong wind disperses it.

A creature that enters the fog for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there is subjected to the following effect. Intelligence Saving Throw: DC 16. Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &reference[Incapacitated] condition until the start of its next turn. Success: Half damage only.

Mind Over Matter.name: Mind Over Matter
Mind Over Matter.description: Trigger: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes damage. Response: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] gains Resistance to the triggering damage.

utility.condition: When the alienist takes damage.

Teleport.name: Teleport
Teleport.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] teleports to an unoccupied space it can see within 60 feet.

Detect Thoughts.name: 侦测思想
Detect Thoughts.description:
你激活下述效应之一。直到法术结束为止，你可以在你随后的回合用一个魔法动作以激活下述任意效应之一。

感知思想。 你感知距你 30 尺内，知晓语言或能够心灵感应的思想的存在。你并不会阅读这些思想，但你知道这里存在一名有理智的生物。

此法术会被 1 尺厚的岩石、泥土或木头，1 寸厚的金属，或薄薄一层铅阻隔。

阅读思想。 选择一名距你 30 尺内的可见生物，或一名距你 30 尺内被感知思想侦测到的生物。你了解到此时目标最关心的事情。如果目标不知晓任何语言也不会心灵感应，则你不能得到任何信息。

在你的下一回合，用一个魔法动作，你可以尝试深入目标的心灵。如果你选择这么做，目标进行一次感知豁免。豁免失败，则你了解到他的逻辑推理、情绪状态以及他头脑中的一些大事（比如忧虑、挚爱和仇恨的事物）。豁免成功，法术终止。无论哪种情况，目标都会知道你正在窥探其心灵，且直到你的注意力从它的心灵上移开为止，目标均可以在其回合内使用动作进行一次 [[/check ability=int skill=arc dc=@attributes.spelldc]] 检定，对抗你的法术豁免DC，目标胜出对抗时，法术终止。

Suggestion.name: Suggestion
Suggestion.description:
You suggest a course of activity—described in no more than 25 words—to one creature you can see within range that can hear and understand you. The suggestion must sound achievable and not involve anything that would obviously deal damage to the target or its allies. For example, you could say, "Fetch the key to the cult's treasure vault, and give the key to me." Or you could say, "Stop fighting, leave this library peacefully, and don't return."

The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the Charmed condition for the duration or until you or your allies deal damage to the target. The Charmed target pursues the suggestion to the best of its ability. The suggested activity can continue for the entire duration, but if the suggested activity can be completed in a shorter time, the spell ends for the target upon completing it.

Pursuing Suggestion.name: Pursuing Suggestion
Pursuing Suggestion.description: The Charmed target pursues the suggestion to the best of its ability. The suggested activity can continue for the entire duration, but if the suggested activity can be completed in a shorter time, the spell ends for the target upon completing it.

Modify Memory.name: Modify Memory
Modify Memory.description:
You attempt to reshape another creature's memories. One creature that you can see within range makes a Wisdom saving throw. If you are fighting the creature, it has Advantage on the save. On a failed save, the target has the &Reference[Charmed apply=false] condition for the duration. While Charmed in this way, the target also has the &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false] condition and is unaware of its surroundings, though it can hear you. If it takes any damage or is targeted by another spell, this spell ends, and no memories are modified.

While this charm lasts, you can affect the target's memory of an event that it experienced within the last 24 hours and that lasted no more than 10 minutes. You can permanently eliminate all memory of the event, allow the target to recall the event with perfect clarity, change its memory of the event's details, or create a memory of some other event.

You must speak to the target to describe how its memories are affected, and it must be able to understand your language for the modified memories to take root. Its mind fills in any gaps in the details of your description. If the spell ends before you finish describing the modified memories, the creature's memory isn't altered. Otherwise, the modified memories take hold when the spell ends.

A modified memory doesn't necessarily affect how a creature behaves, particularly if the memory contradicts the creature's natural inclinations, alignment, or beliefs. An illogical modified memory, such as a false memory of how much the creature enjoyed swimming in acid, is dismissed as a bad dream. The DM might deem a modified memory too nonsensical to affect a creature.

A @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplRemoveCurs]{Remove Curse} or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplGreaterRes]{Greater Restoration} spell cast on the target restores the creature's true memory.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can alter the target's memories of an event that took place up to 7 days ago (level 6 spell slot), 30 days ago (level 7 spell slot), 365 days ago (level 8 spell slot), or any time in the creature's past (level 9 spell slot).

Memory Modification.name: Memory Modification
Memory Modification.description: While &Reference[Charmed apply=false] in this way, the target also has the &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false] condition and is unaware of its surroundings, though it can hear you. If it takes any damage or is targeted by another spell, this spell ends, and no memories are modified.

Telekinesis.name: 心灵遥控
Telekinesis.description:
You gain the ability to move or manipulate creatures or objects by thought. When you cast the spell and as a Magic action on your later turns before the spell ends, you can exert your will on one creature or object that you can see within range, causing the appropriate effect below. You can affect the same target round after round or choose a new one at any time. If you switch targets, the prior target is no longer affected by the spell.

Creature. You can try to move a Huge or smaller creature. The target must succeed on a Strength saving throw, or you move it up to 30 feet in any direction within the spell's range. Until the end of your next turn, the creature has the &Reference[Restrained] condition, and if you lift it into the air, it is suspended there. It falls at the end of your next turn unless you use this option on it again and it fails the save.

Object. You can try to move a Huge or smaller object. If the object isn't being worn or carried, you automatically move it up to 30 feet in any direction within the spell's range.

If the object is worn or carried by a creature, that creature must succeed on a Strength saving throw, or you pull the object away and move it up to 30 feet in any direction within the spell's range.

You can exert fine control on objects with your telekinetic grip, such as manipulating a simple tool, opening a door or a container, stowing or retrieving an item from an open container, or pouring the contents from a vial.

Aura of Storms.name: Aura of Storms
Aura of Storms.description: A creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of the [[lookup @name]] takes [[/damage average]] damage.

Frightful Screech.name: Frightful Screech
Frightful Screech.description: Wisdom Saving Throw: DC 15, one creature within 120 feet of the [[lookup @name]] that can hear them. Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &reference[Frightened] condition (save ends). While Frightened, the target must take the Dash action and move away from the [[lookup @name]] by the safest available route on each of its turns unless there is nowhere to move.

Frightful Screech.name: Frightful Screech
Frightful Screech.description:
You are &reference[addled apply=false]. You can repeat your saving throw against this effect at the end of each of your turns, ending the effect on a success.

While Frightened in this way, you must take the Dash action and move away from the Crimson Countess by the safest available route on each of your turns unless there is nowhere to mvoe.

Lightning Strike.name: Lightning Strike
Lightning Strike.description: Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 15, each creatures in a 60-foot long, 5-foot wide Line. Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &reference[Shocked] condition until the end of its next turn. Success: Half damage only.

Shocked.name: Shocked
Shocked.description: You are &reference[shocked apply=false] until the end of your next turn.

Pluck.name: Pluck
Pluck.description: The [[lookup @name]] doesn't need to spend extra movement to drag a Medium or smaller creature &reference[Grappled apply=false] by it.

Epic Boss.name: Epic Boss
Epic Boss.description:
This creature is an Epic Boss, a unique foe designed to pose a solo threat to an entire adventuring party. As such, it has additional game rules that sets it apart from normal creatures:

[[lookup @name]] always takes their turn on Initiative count 20. On their turn, they can use their movement and interaction as normal. However, they does not take an action or Bonus Action on their turn unless forced to do so by a spell or other effect. Instead, [[lookup @name]] takes one of the following Epic Actions at the end of each player character's turn.

All this creature's actions are Epic Actions.

  • @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.monsters.Actor.syCsNXouOCtFZeb0.Item.c8ANnIaj5GjTb3lK]{Grasping Talons}

  • @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.monsters.Actor.syCsNXouOCtFZeb0.Item.9g53Ss4OE3syf3kl]{Lightning Javelin}

  • @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.monsters.Actor.syCsNXouOCtFZeb0.Item.h370mPt6zezgsZ3U]{Aerial Acrobat}

  • @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.monsters.Actor.syCsNXouOCtFZeb0.Item.0RH1pR7TLIjMQ3T4]{Frightful Screech}

  • @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.monsters.Actor.syCsNXouOCtFZeb0.Item.z114Sj5v8fCLowzh]{Lightning Strike}

  • @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.monsters.Actor.syCsNXouOCtFZeb0.Item.Q1ArvTAgL3d7UUVa]{Epic Resistance}

Epic Resistance.name: Epic Resistance
Epic Resistance.description: [[lookup @name]] chooses one condition, spell, or other effect currently affecting them and rolls [[/r 1d20]]. On an 11 or higher, the effect ends on them. [[lookup @name]] can use this Epic Action even if they would otherwise be unable to take actions, their actions are being controlled by another creature, or if a spell or effect alters their game statistics.

Grasping Talons.name: Grasping Talons
Grasping Talons.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]], and if the target is Medium or smaller, it has the &reference[Grappled] condition (escape DC 15).

Aerial Acrobat.name: Aerial Acrobat
Aerial Acrobat.description: The [[lookup @name]] flies up to her Speed without provoking Opportunity Attacks.

Fully Contaminated.name: Fully Contaminated
Fully Contaminated.description: The [[lookup @name]] is immune to &reference[drakkenheimContamination] and has Advantage on saving throws against contaminated spells. The [[lookup @name]] may cast contaminated spells even though it does not gain Contamination levels.

Life Support System.name: Life Support System
Life Support System.description: The [[lookup @name]] is protected by three machine nodes that make up its Life Support System. The nodes are positioned in a triangle, each no further than 30 feet apart from the rest. Each node is a Large object with AC 20, 25 Hit Points per player character, and Immunity to Poison and Psychic damage. The [[lookup @name]] can't move or be moved more than 60 feet away from any two of its Life Support System nodes.

Nightmare Aura.name: Nightmare Aura
Nightmare Aura.description: A creature that starts its turn within 120 feet of the [[lookup @name]] takes [[/damage average]] damage.

Shield Generator.name: Shield Generator
Shield Generator.description: As long as at least one machine node in the Life Support System remains, the [[lookup @name]]'s Immunities can't be ignored except by effects caused by level 9 spells or artifacts. If all nodes are destroyed, the [[lookup @name]] loses its Immunities.

Shield Generator.name: Shield Generator
Shield Generator.description: As long as at least one machine node in the Life Support System remains, the Think Tank’s Immunities can’t be ignored except by effects caused by level 9 spells or artifacts. If all nodes are destroyed, the Think Tank loses its Immunities.

Telepathic Eavesdropping.name: Telepathic Eavesdropping
Telepathic Eavesdropping.description: The [[lookup @name]] can project its consciousness to see and hear any creature or location within 5 miles as if it had cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplScrying000]{Scrying} (no action required). It can read the thoughts of creatures in this area, communicate with them telepathically, and listen in on telepathic communications which occur between other creatures in the region. It remains aware of its own surroundings while doing so. It cannot observe the area within a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbPrivateSanctu]{Private Sanctum} spell or locations and creatures protected by magic which blocks divination or scrying sensors.

Contaminated Blast.name: Contaminated Blast
Contaminated Blast.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]]. Constitution Saving Throw: DC 20. Failure: The target gains a &reference[drakkenheimContamination] level.

Telekinetic Grip.name: Telekinetic Grip
Telekinetic Grip.description:
The [[lookup @name]] reaches out with its mind to hold one creature or object it can see within 120 feet of it in its psychic grasp. If the target is a creature, it is subjected to the following effect. Strength Saving Throw: DC 20. Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target is moved up to 30 feet in any direction and has the &reference[Restrained] condition until it escapes or the [[lookup @name]] has the &reference[Incapacitated apply=false] condition. The [[lookup @name]] can hold up to two creatures or objects in its grip at one time. On its turn, a held creature can take an action to repeat the save, escaping the grip on a success.

If the target is an object weighing 1,000 pounds or less that isn't being worn or carried, it is telekinetically moved up to 30 feet in any direction. The [[lookup @name]] can also exert fine control on objects with its telekinesis, such as manipulating surgical tools or opening a door or a container.

Telekinetic Grip.name: Telekinetic Grip
Telekinetic Grip.description: You have been telekinetically &reference[restrained apply=false] by the Think Tank. You can repeat your save against this feature as an action, ending the effect on yourself on a successful save.

Pluck the Puppet Strings.name: Pluck the Puppet Strings
Pluck the Puppet Strings.description: Wisdom Saving Throw: DC 20, one creature within 120 feet of the [[lookup @name]]. Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target must use its Reaction to move up to its Speed directly toward a creature of the [[lookup @name]]'s choice. If the target ends this movement within reach of the chosen creature, it must make a melee weapon attack against that creature with Advantage.

Mind Cage.name: Mind Cage
Mind Cage.description: Intelligence Saving Throw: DC 20, one creature the [[lookup @name]] can see within 120 feet. Success: [[/damage average]] damage. Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target perceives itself to be trapped within a nightmare conjured forth from the depths of its own psyche until it escapes. While trapped, the target has the &reference[Immobilized apply=false], &reference[Blinded apply=false], and &reference[Deafened apply=false] conditions. On its turn, the target can take an action to repeat the save. Each time it does, it takes [[/damage average]] damage. On a success, the effect ends for it.

Unbind Gravity.name: Unbind Gravity
Unbind Gravity.description:
The [[lookup @name]] controls gravity in a 200-foot Cube centered on itself until the end of the next round. Each time the [[lookup @name]] uses this Epic Action, it decides which direction gravity pulls within the area. All creatures and objects that aren't somehow anchored to the ground in the area fall in the chosen direction until they reach the edge of the area. A creature can make a [[/save dex 20]] saving throw to grab onto a fixed object it can reach, avoiding the fall on a success.

If some solid object (such as a ceiling) is encountered in this fall, falling objects and creatures strike it just as they would during a nor- mal downward fall. If an object or creature reaches the edge of the area without striking anything, it remains there, oscillating slightly, for the duration.

Alternatively, the [[lookup @name]] can decide to prevent gravity from acting within the area. When it does, creatures within the area without a Fly Speed levitate in midair, and must move by pushing or pulling against a fixed object or surface within reach (such as a wall or a ceiling), which allows them to move as if they were climbing. Unattended objects float around randomly.

If the [[lookup @name]] doesn't use this Epic Action during the next round, the effect ends and affected objects and creatures fall back down.

Epic Boss.name: Epic Boss
Epic Boss.description:
This creature is an Epic Boss, a unique foe designed to pose a solo threat to an entire adventuring party. As such, it has additional game rules that sets it apart from normal creatures:

The [[lookup @name]] always takes their turn on Initiative count 20. On their turn, they can use their movement and interaction as normal. However, they do not take an action or Bonus Action on their turn unless forced to do so by a spell or other effect. Instead, the [[lookup @name]] takes one of the following Epic Actions at the end of each player character's turn.

All this creature's actions are Epic Actions.

  • @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.monsters.Actor.tGMG5oks7iSWw3J3.Item.8p4Fwyc088pLRMiW]{Contaminated Blast}

  • @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.monsters.Actor.tGMG5oks7iSWw3J3.Item.X6c8dp778EINaEdg]{Telekinetic Grip}

  • @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.monsters.Actor.tGMG5oks7iSWw3J3.Item.nX37QYy8R6knJexv]{Pluck the Puppet Strings}

  • @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.monsters.Actor.tGMG5oks7iSWw3J3.Item.ytQgwRwsyDdYKK2X]{Mind Cage}

  • @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.monsters.Actor.tGMG5oks7iSWw3J3.Item.DiZteu8X1H0KMaJP]{Unbind Gravity}

  • @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.monsters.Actor.tGMG5oks7iSWw3J3.Item.dyXm5u69uNG58SPQ]{Epic Resistance}

Epic Boss.name: Epic Boss
Epic Boss.description:
This creature is an Epic Boss, a unique foe designed to pose a solo threat to an entire adventuring party. As such, it has additional game rules that sets it apart from normal creatures.

The creature always takes their turn on Initiative count 20. On their turn, they can use their movement and interaction as normal. However, they do not take an action or Bonus Action on their turn unless forced to do so by a spell or other effect. Instead, the creature takes one of the Epic Actions they have available.

Epic Resistance.name: Epic Resistance
Epic Resistance.description: The [[lookup @name]] chooses one condition, spell, or other effect currently affecting them and rolls [[/r 1d20]]. On an 11 or higher, the effect ends on them. The [[lookup @name]] can use this Epic Action even if they would otherwise be unable to take actions, their actions are being controlled by another creature, or if a spell or effect alters their game statistics.

Spindly Claw.name: Spindly Claw
Spindly Claw.description: Constitution Saving Throw: DC 11, one creature within 5 ft. Failure: [[/damage average]] damage and the target gains one &reference[drakkenheimContamination] level. Success: Half damage only.

Suckered Bite.name: Suckered Bite
Suckered Bite.description: Charisma Saving Throw: DC 15, one creature within 5ft. Failure: [[/damage average]] damage and the target has the &reference[Bewildered] condition (save ends) and the [[lookup @name lowercase]] regains 10 (3d6) Hit Points. Success: Half damage only.

Suckered Bite.name: Suckered Bite
Suckered Bite.description: You are &reference[bewildered apply=false]. You can repeat your saving throw against this effect at the end of each of your turns, ending the effect on a success.

Plane Shift.name: Plane Shift
Plane Shift.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplPlaneShift]{[[lookup @item.name]]} targeting only itself, requiring no components and using Charisma as its spellcasting ability.

Siphon Spell.name: Siphon Spell
Siphon Spell.description: Trigger: A spell is cast by a creature within 60 feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]. Response: Intelligence Saving Throw: DC 14, that creature. Failure: [[/damage average]] damage and the spell fails, but no resources are expended by the spell's casting.

save.condition: When a creature casts a spell within 60 feet of the Interloper.

Teleport.name: Teleport
Teleport.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] teleports to an unoccupied space it can see within 30 feet.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes one [[/item .lUDLcxTxGGlv5EIe]] attack and one [[/item .B7QKiK7nUWxZiUYq]] attack. If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] has used [[/item .aWDsfrYU9Ze9y7dh]] since the end of its last turn, it can instead make three Spindly Claw or Suckered Bite attacks.

Pack Tactics.name: Pack Tactics
Pack Tactics.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally doesn't have the &reference[Incapacitated apply=false] condition.

Aberrant Traits.name: Aberrant Traits
Aberrant Traits.description:
Given the contamination and delerium present within the Space Between Worlds, all creatures who dwell there are the product of contamination and unaffected by the normal dangers of delerium. As an aberrant, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] has the following traits:

  • Fully Contaminated. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] is immune to &reference[drakkenheimContamination] and has Advantage on saving throws against contaminated spells. This creature may cast contaminated spells even though it does not gain Contamination levels.

  • Delerium Healing. As an action, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can touch a delerium shard to regain 10 (3d6) Hit Points. Once the [[lookup @name lowercase]] has used a delerium shard in this way, the shard can't be used in this manner again for 24 hours.

  • Alien Intellect. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] is immune to any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts, as well as any divination spell that it refuses. Wisdom (Insight) checks made to ascertain the [[lookup @name lowercase]]s intentions or sincerity have Disadvantage.

affects.special: a delerium shard

w1u9fBG1lGxN0H4f.name: Plane Shift
w1u9fBG1lGxN0H4f.description:
You and up to eight willing creatures who link hands in a circle are transported to a different plane of existence. You can specify a target destination in general terms, such as the City of Brass on the Elemental Plane of Fire or the palace of Dispater on the second level of the Nine Hells, and you appear in or near that destination, as determined by the DM.

Alternatively, if you know the sigil sequence of a teleportation circle on another plane of existence, this spell can take you to that circle. If the teleportation circle is too small to hold all the creatures you transported, they appear in the closest unoccupied spaces next to the circle.

materials.value: a forked, metal rod worth 250+ GP and attuned to a plane of existence

affects.special: you and up to eight willing creatures

Blood Frenzy.name: Blood Frenzy
Blood Frenzy.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Advantage on melee attack rolls against a creature with the &reference[Bloodied] condition.

Blood Shield.name: Blood Shield
Blood Shield.description: Whenever the [[lookup @name lowercase]] damages a creature that has blood, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] gains 15 Temporary Hit Points.

Morrigan's Fury.name: Morrigan's Fury
Morrigan's Fury.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] howls at the moon, gaining Resistance to all damage except Acid and Radiant damage for 1 minute or until it has the &reference[Incapacitated] condition. As part of this Bonus Action, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] moves up to half its Speed toward a Hostile creature without provoking Opportunity Attacks.

Morrigan's Fury.name: Morrigan's Fury
Morrigan's Fury.description: The Zealot of Morrigan has Resistance to all damage except Acid and Radiant damage for 1 minute or until it has the &reference[Incapacitated] condition.

Vampire Weaknesses.name: Vampire Weaknesses
Vampire Weaknesses.description:
As a vampire, this creature has the following weaknesses:

  • Forbiddance. The vampire can't enter a residence without an invitation from one of the occupants.

  • Harmed by Running Water. The vampire takes [[/damage activity=TXfKdpwrbcIMoY3l]] damage when it ends its turn in running water.

  • Stake to the Heart. If a Piercing weapon made of wood is driven into the vampire's heart while the vampire is Incapacitated in its resting place, the vampire is Paralyzed until the stake is removed.

  • Sunlight Hypersensitivity. The vampire takes [[/damage activity=agngcqt5cICRvCaw]] damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has Disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

Running Water.name: Running Water
Running Water.condition: If the vampire ends their turn in running water.

Spider Climb.name: Spider Climb
Spider Climb.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes three attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of [[/item tXb67Q2TEMya5Yey]].

Claws.name: Claws
Claws.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]], and if the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the &reference[Grappled] condition (escape DC 21).

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description: Constitution Saving Throw: DC 15, one creature within 5 feet that is willing or has the &reference[Grappled apply=false], &reference[Incapacitated apply=false], or &reference[Restrained apply=false] condition. Failure: [[/damage average]] damage. The target’s Hit Point Maximum decreases by an amount equal to the Necrotic damage taken, and the [[lookup @name lowercase]] regains Hit Points equal to that amount.

affects.special: A creature that is willing or has the Grappled, Incapacitated, or Restrained condition.

Regeneration.name: Regeneration
Regeneration.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] regains 10 Hit Points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 Hit Point and isn't in sunlight or running water. If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes Radiant damage or damage from holy water, this trait doesn't function at the start of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s next turn.

Tunneler.name: Tunneler
Tunneler.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can burrow through solid rock at half its Burrowing Speed and leaves a 10-foot diameter tunnel in its wake.

Breach.name: Breach
Breach.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] moves up to its Speed, entering the spaces of Large or smaller creatures. Each creature whose space it enters is subjected once to the following effect.

At the end of its movement, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can make one Bite attack against a &reference[Prone apply=false] creature as a Bonus Action. Strength Saving Throw: DC 22. Success: The target is pushed 5 feet away from the [[lookup @name lowercase]] into a space of its choice. If the target chooses not to move, it suffers the effects of a failure. Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target is pushed 10 feet away from the [[lookup @name lowercase]] and has the &reference[Prone] condition.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes a [[/item 3TeArtYkuVxyZh8J]] attack, then makes [[/item 3TeArtYkuVxyZh8J]] attacks against each creature adjacent to the first target.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]] and if it is Large or smaller, the target is subjected to the following effect. Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 22. Failure: The target is swallowed by the [[lookup @name lowercase]]. The target has the &reference[Blinded] and &reference[Restrained] conditions, has &reference[TotalCover] against effects originating from outside the [[lookup @name lowercase]], and takes [[/damage average activity=jFLFH7xm929QYRmN]] damage at the start of each of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s turns. A creature that takes this Necrotic damage must also succeed on a DC 19 Constitution saving throw or gain one Contamination level.

If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes 30+ damage on a single turn from a creature inside it, it must succeed on a [[/save activity=MX0vfHVOhoscqqCc]] saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which land in spaces within 10 feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] with the &reference[Prone] condition. If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] dies, a swallowed creature no longer has the Restrained condition and can escape from the corpse using 20 feet of movement, exiting with the &reference[Prone] condition.

Regurgitate Save.name: Regurgitate Save
Regurgitate Save.condition: When the wurm takes 30+ damage on a single turn from a creature inside it.

Swallowed.name: Swallowed
Swallowed.description:
You have been swallowed. While swallowed, you are &reference[blinded apply=false] &reference[restrained apply=false], and have &reference[totalcover] against effects originating from outside the wurm.

At the start of each of the wurm's turns, you take [[/damage average 8d8 necrotic]] damage and must succeed on a [[/save 19 con]] saving throw or gain one Contamination level.

Death Burst.name: Death Burst
Death Burst.description: Trigger: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] is reduced to 0 Hit Points by damage that isn't Radiant or from a Critical Hit. Response: Constitution Saving Throw: DC 10, each creature in a 5-foot Emanation originating from the [[lookup @name lowercase]]. Failure: [[/damage average]] damage. Failure by 5 or More: The target gains one Contamination level.

save.condition: When the haze husk is reduced to 0 hit points by damage that isn't radiant or from a critical hit.

Fully Contaminated.name: Fully Contaminated
Fully Contaminated.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] is immune to &reference[drakkenheimContamination] and has Advantage on saving throws against contaminated spells. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] may cast contaminated spells even though it does not gain Contamination levels.

Delerium Healing.name: Delerium Healing
Delerium Healing.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] touches a delerium shard and regains 10 (3d6) Hit Points. Once the [[lookup @name lowercase]] has used a delerium shard in this way, it can't be used in this manner again for 24 hours.

affects.special: a delerium shard

Pack Tactics.name: Pack Tactics
Pack Tactics.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally doesn't have the &reference[Incapacitated apply=false] condition.

Spider Climb.name: Spider Climb
Spider Climb.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

Vampire Weaknesses.name: Vampire Weaknesses
Vampire Weaknesses.description:
As a vampire, this creature has the following weaknesses:

  • Forbiddance. The vampire can't enter a residence without an invitation from one of the occupants.

  • Harmed by Running Water. The vampire takes [[/damage activity=TXfKdpwrbcIMoY3l]] damage when it ends its turn in running water.

  • Stake to the Heart. If a Piercing weapon made of wood is driven into the vampire's heart while the vampire is Incapacitated in its resting place, the vampire is Paralyzed until the stake is removed.

  • Sunlight Hypersensitivity. The vampire takes [[/damage activity=agngcqt5cICRvCaw]] damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has Disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

Running Water.name: Running Water
Running Water.condition: If the vampire ends their turn in running water.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of [[/item tSP2lPvNPc6wc3Xt]].

Aggressive.name: Aggressive
Aggressive.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] moves up to its Speed toward a Hostile creature it can see.

Claws.name: Claws
Claws.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]], and if the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the &reference[Grappled] condition (escape DC 13).

Contaminated Bite.name: Contaminated Bite
Contaminated Bite.description: Constitution Saving Throw: DC 15, one creature within 5 feet that is willing or has the &reference[Grappled apply=false], &reference[Incapacitated apply=false], or &reference[Restrained apply=false] condition. Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target gains one &reference[drakkenheimContamination] level. Success: Half damage only.

affects.special: A creature that is willing or has the Grappled, Incapacitated, or Restrained condition.

Swarm.name: Swarm
Swarm.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny insect. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can't regain Hit Points or gain Temporary Hit Points.

Contaminated Bites.name: Contaminated Bites
Contaminated Bites.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]], or [[/damage average 1d6 necrotic]] if the [[lookup @name lowercase]] has the &reference[bloodied] condition.

Searing Light.name: Searing Light
Searing Light.description: Constitution Saving Throw: DC 14, one creature the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within 30 feet. Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &reference[Blinded] condition until the start of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] next turn. Success: Half damage only.

Searing Light.name: Searing Light
Searing Light.description: You are &reference[blinded apply=false] until the start of the flamekeeper's next turn.

Radiant Flames.name: Radiant Flames
Radiant Flames.description: Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 14, each creature of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s choice in a 30-foot Emanation originating from the [[lookup @name lowercase]]. Failure: [[/damage average]] damage. Success: Half damage. Failure or Success: Magical Darkness in the area is dispelled.

Guidance.name: 神导术
Guidance.description: You touch a willing creature and choose a skill. Until the spell ends, the creature adds 1d4 to any ability check using the chosen skill.

Light.name: Light
Light.description:
You touch one Large or smaller object that isn't being worn or carried by someone else. Until the spell ends, the object sheds Bright Light in a 20-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 20 feet. The light can be colored as you like.

Covering the object with something opaque blocks the light. The spell ends if you cast it again.

Spare the Dying.name: 维生术
Spare the Dying.description:
Choose a creature within range that has 0 Hit Points and isn't dead. The creature becomes Stable.

Cantrip Upgrade. The range doubles when you reach levels 5 (30 feet), 11 (60 feet), and 17 (120 feet).

affects.special: 0 Hit Points and isn't dead

Thaumaturgy.name: Thaumaturgy
Thaumaturgy.description:
You manifest a minor wonder within range. You create one of the effects below within range. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its 1-minute effects active at a time.

Altered Eyes. You alter the appearance of your eyes for 1 minute.

Booming Voice. Your voice booms up to three times as loud as normal for 1 minute. For the duration, you have Advantage on [[/check ability=cha skill=itm]] checks.

Fire Play. You cause flames to flicker, brighten, dim, or change color for 1 minute.

Invisible Hand. You instantaneously cause an unlocked door or window to fly open or slam shut.

Phantom Sound. You create an instantaneous sound that originates from a point of your choice within range, such as a rumble of thunder, the cry of a raven, or ominous whispers.

Tremors. You cause harmless tremors in the ground for 1 minute.

Bless.name: Bless
Bless.description:
You bless up to three creatures within range. Whenever a target makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target adds 1d4 to the attack roll or save.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 1.

Blessed.name: Blessed
Blessed.description: Whenever a target makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target adds 1d4 to the attack roll or save.

Healing Word.name: Healing Word
Healing Word.description:
A creature of your choice that you can see within range regains Hit Points equal to 2d4 plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The healing increases by 2d4 for each spell slot level above 1.

Lesser Restoration.name: Lesser Restoration
Lesser Restoration.description: You touch a creature and end one condition on it: &Reference[blinded], &Reference[deafened], &Reference[paralyzed], or &Reference[poisoned].

Aid.name: Aid
Aid.description:
Choose up to three creatures within range. Each target's Hit Point maximum and current Hit Points increase by 5 for the duration.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. Each target's Hit Points increase by 5 for each spell slot level above 2.

Foundry Note

The default Heal activity is configured with multiple Active Effects representing the temporary maximum Hit Points provided by this spell.

Users should apply the appropriate Active Effect for the spell slot level used in the casting of this spell.

Level 2: +5 Max HP.name: Level 2: +5 Max HP
Level 2: +5 Max HP.description: The target's Hit Point maximum is increased for the duration.

Level 3: +10 Max HP.name: Level 3: +10 Max HP
Level 3: +10 Max HP.description: The target's Hit Point maximum is increased for the duration.

Level 4: +15 Max HP.name: Level 4: +15 Max HP
Level 4: +15 Max HP.description: The target's Hit Point maximum is increased for the duration.

Level 5: +20 Max HP.name: Level 5: +20 Max HP
Level 5: +20 Max HP.description: The target's Hit Point maximum is increased for the duration.

Level 6: +25 Max HP.name: Level 6: +25 Max HP
Level 6: +25 Max HP.description: The target's Hit Point maximum is increased for the duration.

Level 7: +30 Max HP.name: Level 7: +30 Max HP
Level 7: +30 Max HP.description: The target's Hit Point maximum is increased for the duration.

Level 8: +35 Max HP.name: Level 8: +35 Max HP
Level 8: +35 Max HP.description: The target's Hit Point maximum is increased for the duration.

Level 9: +40 Max HP.name: Level 9: +40 Max HP
Level 9: +40 Max HP.description: The target's Hit Point maximum is increased for the duration.

Dispel Magic.name: 解除魔法
Dispel Magic.description:
在施法距离内指定一名生物、一个物件或一处魔法效应。所有影响该目标的三环或更低环阶法术即告终止。每个影响目标的四环或更高环阶法术都需要以你的施法属性进行一次属性检定（DC 10 + 目标法术环阶），检定成功时目标法术终止。

升环施法： 你直接终止影响目标的小于等于该施法环阶的法术效应。

Spirit Guardians.name: Spirit Guardians
Spirit Guardians.description:
Protective spirits flit around you in a 15-foot Emanation for the duration. If you are good or neutral, their spectral form appears angelic or fey (your choice). If you are evil, they appear fiendish.

When you cast this spell, you can designate creatures to be unaffected by it. Any other creature's Speed is halved in the Emanation, and whenever the Emanation enters a creature's space and whenever a creature enters the Emanation or ends its turn there, the creature must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 3d8 Radiant damage (if you are good or neutral) or 3d8 Necrotic damage (if you are evil). On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage. A creature makes this save only once per turn.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d8 for each spell slot level above 3.

Half Speed.name: Half Speed
Half Speed.description: The creature's speed is halved while within the Emanation.

Contaminated Blast.name: Contaminated Blast
Contaminated Blast.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]]. The first time the target is hit by a Contaminated Blast each turn, it is subjected to the following effect. Constitution Saving Throw: DC 13. Failure: The target gains one &reference[drakkenheimContamination] level.

Animate Haze Husk.name: Animate Haze Husk
Animate Haze Husk.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] reanimates the corpse of a @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.monsters.Actor.uzeoZGIO0MULOG8a]{Haze Husk} it can see within 60 feet. The haze husk is revived with 5 Hit Points and immediately stands.

Death Burst.name: Death Burst
Death Burst.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] explodes when it dies and it hasn't taken Force, Radiant, or Thunder damage since its last turn. Constitution Saving Throw: DC 16, each creature in a 30-foot Emanation originating from the [[lookup @name lowercase]]. Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target gains one Contamination level. Failure or Success: The explosion triggers a random Arcane Anomaly.

save.condition: When the elemental dies and it hasn't taken force, radiant, or thunder damage since its last turn.

Earth Glide.name: Earth Glide
Earth Glide.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can burrow through nonmagical, unworked earth and stone. While doing so, the elemental doesn't disturb the material it moves through.

Shard Slam.name: Shard Slam
Shard Slam.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]]. Constitution Saving Throw: DC 16. Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target gains one &reference[drakkenheimContamination] level.

Dual Minds.name: Dual Minds
Dual Minds.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Advantage on saving throws to avoid or end the &reference[Blinded apply=false], &reference[Charmed apply=false], &reference[Deafened apply=false], &reference[Frightened apply=false], &reference[Stunned apply=false], and &reference[Unconscious apply=false] conditions.

Telekinetic Grip.name: Telekinetic Grip
Telekinetic Grip.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] reaches out with its mind to hold one creature or object it can see within 120 feet of it in its psychic grasp. If the target is a creature, it is subjected to the following effect. Strength Saving Throw: DC 16. Failure: The target is moved up to 30 feet in any direction and has the &reference[Restrained] condition until the start of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s next turn or until the [[lookup @name lowercase]] has the &reference[Incapacitated apply=false] condition.

If the target is an object weighing 300 pounds or less that isn't being worn or carried, it is telekinetically moved up to 30 feet in any direction. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can also exert fine control on objects with its telekinesis, such as manipulating a simple tool or opening a door or a container.

Telekinetic Grip.name: Telekinetic Grip
Telekinetic Grip.description: You are &reference[restrained apply=false] until the start of the cerebrograft's next turn, or until the cerebrograft has the &reference[incapacitated apply=false] condition.

Psychic Crush.name: Psychic Crush
Psychic Crush.description: Intelligence Saving Throw: DC 16, each creature in a 20-foot Emanation originating from the cerebrograft. Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &reference[Dazed] condition (save ends). Failure by 5 or More: The target instead has the &reference[Stunned] condition (save ends). Success: Half damage only.

Psychic Crush: Dazed.name: Psychic Crush: Dazed
Psychic Crush: Dazed.description: You are &reference[dazed apply=false]. You can repeat your saving throw against this effect at the end of each of your turns, ending the effect on a success.

Psychic Crush: Stunned.name: Psychic Crush: Stunned
Psychic Crush: Stunned.description: You are &reference[stunned apply=false]. You can repeat your saving throw against this effect at the end of each of your turns, ending the effect on a success.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item ZlHjLDPiPObTEOnN]] attacks and uses [[/item HACS20GLleq1dqbv]].

Haze Aura.name: Haze Aura
Haze Aura.description: A creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes [[/damage average]] damage.

Tail.name: Tail
Tail.description: Strength Saving Throw: DC 18, one creature within 20 feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]. Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and if the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the &reference[Prone] condition.

Mage Hand.name: 法师之手
Mage Hand.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMageHand00]{Mage Hand} using Charisma as the spellcasting ability. The hand created by the spell is &reference[invisible apply=false].

Aberrant Traits.name: Aberrant Traits
Aberrant Traits.description:
Given the contamination and delerium present within the Space Between Worlds, all creatures who dwell there are the product of contamination and unaffected by the normal dangers of delerium. As an aberrant, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] has the following traits:

  • Fully Contaminated. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] is immune to &reference[drakkenheimContamination] and has Advantage on saving throws against contaminated spells. This creature may cast contaminated spells even though it does not gain Contamination levels.

  • Delerium Healing. As an action, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can touch a delerium shard to regain 10 (3d6) Hit Points. Once the [[lookup @name lowercase]] has used a delerium shard in this way, the shard can't be used in this manner again for 24 hours.

  • Alien Intellect. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] is immune to any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts, as well as any divination spell that it refuses. Wisdom (Insight) checks made to ascertain the [[lookup @name lowercase]]s intentions or sincerity have Disadvantage.

affects.special: a delerium shard

Epic Boss.name: Epic Boss
Epic Boss.description:
This creature is an Epic Boss, a unique foe designed to pose a solo threat to an entire adventuring party. As such, it has additional game rules that sets it apart from normal creatures:

The [[lookup @name lowercase]] always takes their turn on Initiative count 20. On their turn, they can use their movement and interaction as normal. However, they do not take an action or Bonus Action on their turn unless forced to do so by a spell or other effect. Instead, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes one of the following Epic Actions at the end of each player character's turn.

All this creature's actions are Epic Actions.

  • @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.monsters.Actor.xw0LdSvseQHlNbq2.Item.HmP8BXCCpkszqkKs]{Bite}

  • @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.monsters.Actor.xw0LdSvseQHlNbq2.Item.ve5esAhbMtwbXkV3]{Contaminated Rend}

  • @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.monsters.Actor.xw0LdSvseQHlNbq2.Item.x7PtJXLSN6MFGdiT]{Tail}

  • @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.monsters.Actor.xw0LdSvseQHlNbq2.Item.9jqxnRpRzanLb6bE]{Octarine Breath}

  • @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.monsters.Actor.xw0LdSvseQHlNbq2.Item.52wANChVKS2lEkyd]{Dimension Hop}

  • @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.monsters.Actor.xw0LdSvseQHlNbq2.Item.9TbgdBXtzNkmDtBX]{Mage Hand}

  • @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.monsters.Actor.xw0LdSvseQHlNbq2.Item.5gfrcrmlObCGMuma]{Epic Resistance}

Epic Boss.name: Epic Boss
Epic Boss.description:
This creature is an Epic Boss, a unique foe designed to pose a solo threat to an entire adventuring party. As such, it has additional game rules that sets it apart from normal creatures.

The creature always takes their turn on Initiative count 20. On their turn, they can use their movement and interaction as normal. However, they do not take an action or Bonus Action on their turn unless forced to do so by a spell or other effect. Instead, the creature takes one of the Epic Actions they have available.

Epic Resistance.name: Epic Resistance
Epic Resistance.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] chooses one condition, spell, or other effect currently affecting them and rolls [[/r 1d20]]. On an 11 or higher, the effect ends on them. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can use this Epic Action even if they would otherwise be unable to take actions, their actions are being controlled by another creature, or if a spell or effect alters their game statistics.

Octarine Breath.name: Octarine Breath
Octarine Breath.description: Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 18, each creature in a 30-foot Cone. Failure: [[/damage average]] damage. Success: Half damage.

Dimension Hop.name: Dimension Hop
Dimension Hop.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] teleports to an unoccupied space it can see within 30 feet.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]], and if the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the &reference[Grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC 18). While Grappled, the target has the &reference[Restrained] condition.

Grappled by Bite.name: Grappled by Bite
Grappled by Bite.description: You are &reference[grappled apply=false] (escape DC 18). While grappled in this way, you are also &reference[restrained apply=false].

Contaminated Rend.name: Contaminated Rend
Contaminated Rend.description: Constitution Saving Throw: DC 15, one creature within 5 feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]. Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target gains one &reference[drakkenheimContamination] level.

hAKIfRWYqeTWiOjf.name: 法师之手
hAKIfRWYqeTWiOjf.description:
A spectral, floating hand appears at a point you choose within range. The hand lasts for the duration. The hand vanishes if it is ever more than 30 feet away from you or if you cast this spell again.

When you cast the spell, you can use the hand to manipulate an object, open an unlocked door or container, stow or retrieve an item from an open container, or pour the contents out of a vial.

As a Magic action on your later turns, you can control the hand thus again. As part of that action, you can move the hand up to 30 feet.

The hand can't attack, activate magic items, or carry more than 10 pounds.

Invisibility.name: Invisibility
Invisibility.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplInvisibili]{Invisibility} on itself, requiring no spell components and using Wisdom as the spell-casting ability.

Reel.name: Reel
Reel.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] pulls each creature &reference[Grappled apply=false] by it up to 25 feet straight toward it.

affects.special: A creature grappled by the hulk.

egDNcl7tDKV2B6Tm.name: Invisibility
egDNcl7tDKV2B6Tm.description:
A creature you touch has the &Reference[invisible apply=false] condition until the spell ends. The spell ends early immediately after the target makes an attack roll, deals damage, or casts a spell.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 2.

Invisible.name: Invisible
Invisible.description: The spell ends early immediately after the target makes an attack roll, deals damage, or casts a spell.

Lashing Tendrils.name: Lashing Tendrils
Lashing Tendrils.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]]. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, the target has the &reference[Grappled] condition (escape DC 16). The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can grapple up to two creatures at once.

Grappled by Lashing Tendrils.name: Grappled by Lashing Tendrils
Grappled by Lashing Tendrils.description: You are &reference[grappled apply=false] (escape DC 16) by the creature.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item sIIg5jfIJhjvQXOM]] attacks and one [[/item HKi2TVP6vHdmpp1P]] attack.

Protective Aura.name: Protective Aura
Protective Aura.description: A creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of [[lookup @name]] takes [[/damage average]] damage.

damage.condition: When a creature starts their turn within 30 feet of Minazorond.

Construct Resilience.name: Construct Resilience
Construct Resilience.description: If damage reduces [[lookup @name]] to 0 Hit Points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 plus the damage taken, unless the damage is Radiant or from a Critical Hit. On a success, [[lookup @name]] drops to 1 Hit Point instead.

save.condition: When damage other than Radiant or from a Critical Hit reduces the creature to 0 hit point.

Tail.name: Tail
Tail.description: Strength Saving Throw: DC 22, one creature [[lookup @name]] can see within 20 feet. Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and if the target is Medium or smaller, it has the &reference[Prone] condition.

Shocking Burst.name: Shocking Burst
Shocking Burst.description: Wisdom Saving Throw: DC 20, one target [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within 120 feet. Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &reference[Shocked] condition. Success: Half damage only.

Terrifying Roar.name: Terrifying Roar
Terrifying Roar.description: Wisdom Saving Throw: DC 20, each creature in a 120-foot Emanation originating from [[lookup @name]] that can hear it. Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &reference[Frightened] condition (save ends).

Breathe Deep.name: Breathe Deep
Breathe Deep.description: [[lookup @name]]'s Breath Weapon recharges. [[lookup @name]] can only use this Epic Action if it's the first Epic Action it has taken this round.

Breath Weapon.name: Breath Weapon
Breath Weapon.description:
[[lookup @name]] uses one of its breath weapons. It can only use this Epic Action if it's the last Epic Action it takes this round.

Lightning Breath. Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 22, each creature in a 120-foot Cone. Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &reference[Shocked] condition. Success: Half damage.

Thunder Breath. Constitution Saving Throw: DC 22, each creature in a 120-foot Cone. Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target is pushed 20 feet away from [[lookup @name lowercase]] and has the Dazed condition (save ends). Failure by 5 or More: Double damage, and the target also has the &reference[Deafened] condition (save ends). Success: Half damage only.

Draconic Rebuke.name: Draconic Rebuke
Draconic Rebuke.description: Trigger: [[lookup @name]] becomes &reference[Bloodied]. It can use this Reaction even if it has the &reference[Incapacitated apply=false] condition or is otherwise unable to take Reactions. Response: All conditions and spells on [[lookup @name]] immediately end unless it chooses to be affected by them, and it can fly up to its Speed without provoking Opportunity Attacks and ignoring &reference[DifficultTerrain]. [[lookup @name]] recharges and immediately uses its Terrifying Roar.

utility.condition: When Minazorond becomes Bloodied.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]], and if the target is Medium or smaller, it has the &reference[Grappled] condition (escape DC 17). While Grappled, the target has the &reference[Restrained] condition.

Grappled by Bite.name: Grappled by Bite
Grappled by Bite.description: You are &reference[grappled apply=false] (escape DC 17). While grappled in this way, you are also &reference[restrained apply=false].

Epic Resistance.name: Epic Resistance
Epic Resistance.description: [[lookup @name]] chooses one condition, spell, or other effect currently affecting them and rolls [[/r 1d20]]. On an 11 or higher, the effect ends on them. [[lookup @name]] can use this Epic Action even if they would otherwise be unable to take actions, their actions are being controlled by another creature, or if a spell or effect alters their game statistics.

Epic Boss.name: Epic Boss
Epic Boss.description:
This creature is an Epic Boss, a unique foe designed to pose a solo threat to an entire adventuring party. As such, it has additional game rules that sets it apart from normal creatures:

[[lookup @name]] always takes their turn on Initiative count 20. On their turn, they can use their movement and interaction as normal. However, they do not take an action or Bonus Action on their turn unless forced to do so by a spell or other effect. Instead, [[lookup @name]] takes one of the following Epic Actions at the end of each player character's turn.

All this creature's actions are Epic Actions.

  • @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.monsters.Actor.yDK41qn8pudLTPYc.Item.cufrgh30u7FwYybR]{Bite}

  • @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.monsters.Actor.yDK41qn8pudLTPYc.Item.XwDErEnjpdskiS6i]{Claw}

  • @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.monsters.Actor.yDK41qn8pudLTPYc.Item.sPZF8SUrGiBgTiz0]{Tail}

  • @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.monsters.Actor.yDK41qn8pudLTPYc.Item.qIbcXLBcV5ylKMAN]{Shocking Burst}

  • @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.monsters.Actor.yDK41qn8pudLTPYc.Item.5JoD6XtmRPiROYXy]{Terrifying Roar}

  • @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.monsters.Actor.yDK41qn8pudLTPYc.Item.SKpngTRISLg75psq]{Breathe Deep}

  • @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.monsters.Actor.yDK41qn8pudLTPYc.Item.sNv2aoHYNrMvMjon]{Breath Weapon}

  • @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-monsters.monsters.Actor.yDK41qn8pudLTPYc.Item.OBTjwGqIjAAKXSIy]{Epic Resistance}

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: [[lookup @name]] has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Warding Aura.name: Warding Aura
Warding Aura.description: [[lookup @name]] projects a 30-foot Emanation of warding magic. The first time on each turn that a creature within the Emanation deals damage or casts a spell on [[lookup @name]], that creature takes [[/damage average]] damage and is pushed 10 feet away from [[lookup @name]].

Teleport.name: Teleport
Teleport.description: [[lookup @name]] teleports to an unoccupied space he can see within 60 feet.

Chain Lightning.name: Chain Lightning
Chain Lightning.description: [[lookup @name]] casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplChainLight], using the spellcasting ability in Spellcasting.

Dispel Magic.name: 解除魔法
Dispel Magic.description: [[lookup @name]] casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDispelMagi], using the spellcasting ability in Spellcasting.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
[[lookup @name]] casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 21, +13 to spell attacks):

At Will: Mage Armor, Mage Hand, Sending

2/Day Each: Arcane Hand ([[lookup @name]] may use an Epic Action to control the hand once per round), Banishment, Dimension Door, Ice Storm, Lightning Bolt, Scrying, Wall of Force

Greater Spellcasting.name: Greater Spellcasting
Greater Spellcasting.description:
[[lookup @name]] casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 21, +13 to spell attacks):

1/Day Each: Forcecage, Globe of Invulnerability, Maze, Prismatic Spray, Prismatic Wall, Teleport

Academy Rings.name: Academy Rings
Academy Rings.description: River can cast a spell they know without expending a use of it.

Counterspell.name: Counterspell
Counterspell.description: [[lookup @name]] casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplCounterspe]{Counterspell} in response to that spell’s trigger, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability.

S7T82zbsY19sIQOD.condition: when you see a creature within range casting a spell with Verbal, Somatic, or Material components

DqNS8XJLauhOhPn0.name: Counterspell
DqNS8XJLauhOhPn0.description: You attempt to interrupt a creature in the process of casting a spell. The creature makes a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the spell dissipates with no effect, and the action, Bonus Action, or Reaction used to cast it is wasted. If that spell was cast with a spell slot, the slot isn't expended.

activation.condition: 当你看见范围内一名生物施展一道法术时执行

Robe of the Archmagi.name: 大法师法袍
Robe of the Archmagi.description:
奇物，传说（需术士、魔契师或法师同调）

这件典雅的长袍由精美的布料制成，并以符文装饰。

着装此长袍时，你获得下列增益：

护甲。若你未着装护甲，你的基础护甲等级为 15 + 你的敏捷调整值。

魔法抗性。 你对抗法术和其他魔法效应进行的豁免检定具有优势。

战争法师。 你的法术豁免DC和法术攻击加值均提升 2。

Foundry Note

大法师护甲激活效应将设定你的护甲等级（AC），若你仍着装护甲则应禁用该效应。

战争法师激活效应会自动提升你的法术豁免DC与法术攻击加值。

Staff of Power.name: Staff of Power
Staff of Power.description:
@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbafcStaffalsoa]{Staff}, Very Rare (Requires Attunement by a Sorcerer, Warlock, or Wizard)

This staff has 20 charges and can be wielded as a magic Quarterstaff that grants a +2 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls made with it. While holding it, you gain a +2 bonus to Armor Class, saving throws, and spell attack rolls.

Spells. While holding the staff, you can cast one of the spells on the following table from it, using your spell save DC. The table indicates how many charges you must expend to cast the spell.

Spell Cost Table

Spell

Charge Cost

@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplConeofCold]{Cone of Cold}

5

@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplFireball00]{Fireball} (level 5 version)

5

@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplGlobeofInv]{Globe of Invulnerability}

6

@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplHoldMonste]{Hold Monster}

5

@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplLevitate00]{Levitate}

2

@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplLightningB]{Lightning Bolt} (level 5 version)

5

@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMagicMissi]{Magic Missile}

1

@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplRayofEnfee]{Ray of Enfeeblement}

1

@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplWallofForc]{Wall of Force}

5

Regaining Charges. The staff regains 2d8 + 4 expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll [[/r 1d20]]. On a 1, the staff retains its +2 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls but loses all other properties. On a 20, the staff regains [[/r 1d8 + 2]] charges.

Retributive Strike. You can take a Magic action to break the staff over your knee or against a solid surface. The staff is destroyed and releases its magic in an explosion that fills a 30-foot Emanation originating from itself. You have a 50 percent chance to instantly travel to a random plane of existence, avoiding the explosion. If you fail to avoid the effect, you take Force damage equal to 16 times the number of charges in the staff. Each other creature in the area makes a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes Force damage equal to 4 times the number of charges in the staff. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage.

Cone of Cold.name: Cone of Cold
Cone of Cold.description:
You unleash a blast of cold air. Each creature in a 60-foot Cone originating from you makes a Constitution saving throw, taking 8d8 Cold damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature killed by this spell becomes a frozen statue until it thaws.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d8 for each spell slot level above 5.

materials.value: a small crystal or glass cone

Fireball.name: Fireball
Fireball.description:
A bright streak flashes from you to a point you choose within range and then blossoms with a low roar into a fiery explosion. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius Sphere centered on that point makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking 8d6 Fire damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

Flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried start burning.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d6 for each spell slot level above 3.

materials.value: a ball of bat guano and sulfur

Globe of Invulnerability.name: Globe of Invulnerability
Globe of Invulnerability.description:
An immobile, shimmering barrier appears in a 10-foot Emanation around you and remains for the duration.

Any spell of level 5 or lower cast from outside the barrier can't affect anything within it. Such a spell can target creatures and objects within the barrier, but the spell has no effect on them. Similarly, the area within the barrier is excluded from areas of effect created by such spells.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The barrier blocks spells of 1 level higher for each spell slot level above 6.

Spell levels blocked:[[@item.level - 1]] and lower

Hold Monster.name: Hold Monster
Hold Monster.description:
Choose a creature that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the Paralyzed condition for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 5.

Paralyzed.name: Paralyzed
Paralyzed.description: At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the [[/save ability=wis]] save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Levitate.name: Levitate
Levitate.description:
One creature or loose object of your choice that you can see within range rises vertically up to 20 feet and remains suspended there for the duration. The spell can levitate an object that weighs up to 500 pounds. An unwilling creature that succeeds on a Constitution saving throw is unaffected.

The target can move only by pushing or pulling against a fixed object or surface within reach (such as a wall or a ceiling), which allows it to move as if it were climbing. You can change the target's altitude by up to 20 feet in either direction on your turn. If you are the target, you can move up or down as part of your move. Otherwise, you can take a Magic action to move the target, which must remain within the spell's range.

When the spell ends, the target floats gently to the ground if it is still aloft.

Levitating.name: Levitating
Levitating.description: The target can move only by pushing or pulling against a fixed object or surface within reach (such as a wall or a ceiling), which allows it to move as if it were climbing.

Lightning Bolt.name: Lightning Bolt
Lightning Bolt.description:
A stroke of lightning forming a 100-foot-long, 5-foot-wide Line blasts out from you in a direction you choose. Each creature in the Line makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking 8d6 Lightning damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d6 for each spell slot level above 3.

materials.value: a bit of fur and a crystal rod

Magic Missile.name: Magic Missile
Magic Missile.description:
You create three glowing darts of magical force. Each dart strikes a creature of your choice that you can see within range. A dart deals 1d4 + 1 Force damage to its target. The darts all strike simultaneously, and you can direct them to hit one creature or several.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The spell creates one more dart for each spell slot level above 1.

[[2 + @item.level]]{Level [[lookup @item.level]] darts}

Ray of Enfeeblement.name: Ray of Enfeeblement
Ray of Enfeeblement.description:
A beam of enervating energy shoots from you toward a creature within range. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a successful save, the target has Disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes until the start of your next turn.

On a failed save, the target has Disadvantage on Strength-based D20 Tests for the duration. During that time, it also subtracts 1d8 from all its damage rolls. The target repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the spell on a success.

Brief Enfeeblement.name: Brief Enfeeblement
Brief Enfeeblement.description: The target has Disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes until the start of your next turn.

Enervated.name: Enervated
Enervated.description: The target has Disadvantage on Strength-based D20 Tests for the duration. During that time, it also subtracts 1d8 from all its damage rolls. The target repeats the [[/save ability=con]] save at the end of each of its turns, ending the spell on a success.

Wall of Force.name: Wall of Force
Wall of Force.description:
An Invisible wall of force springs into existence at a point you choose within range. The wall appears in any orientation you choose, as a horizontal or vertical barrier or at an angle. It can be free floating or resting on a solid surface. You can form it into a hemispherical dome or a globe with a radius of up to 10 feet, or you can shape a flat surface made up of ten 10-foot-by-10-foot panels. Each panel must be contiguous with another panel. In any form, the wall is 1/4 inch thick and lasts for the duration. If the wall cuts through a creature's space when it appears, the creature is pushed to one side of the wall (you choose which side).

Nothing can physically pass through the wall. It is immune to all damage and can't be dispelled by @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDispelMagi]{Dispel Magic}. A @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDisintegra]{Disintegrate} spell destroys the wall instantly, however. The wall also extends into the Ethereal Plane and blocks ethereal travel through the wall.

OivhA8TQkYSBHVij.name: Dispel Magic
OivhA8TQkYSBHVij.description:
Choose one creature, object, or magical effect within range. Any ongoing spell of level 3 or lower on the target ends. For each ongoing spell of level 4 or higher on the target, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability (DC 10 plus that spell's level). On a successful check, the spell ends.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You automatically end a spell on the target if the spell's level is equal to or less than the level of the spell slot you use.

18blLV8o1VRRQMwF.name: Chain Lightning
18blLV8o1VRRQMwF.description:
You launch a lightning bolt toward a target you can see within range. Three bolts then leap from that target to as many as three other targets of your choice, each of which must be within 30 feet of the first target. A target can be a creature or an object and can be targeted by only one of the bolts.

Each target makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking 10d8 Lightning damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. One additional bolt leaps from the first target to another target for each spell slot level above 6.

affects.special: secondary targets must be within 30 feet of initial target

Forcecage.name: Forcecage
Forcecage.description:
An immobile, Invisible, Cube-shaped prison composed of magical force springs into existence around an area you choose within range. The prison can be a cage or a solid box, as you choose.

A prison in the shape of a cage can be up to 20 feet on a side and is made from 1/2-inch diameter bars spaced 1/2 inch apart. A prison in the shape of a box can be up to 10 feet on a side, creating a solid barrier that prevents any matter from passing through it and blocking any spells cast into or out from the area.

When you cast the spell, any creature that is completely inside the cage's area is trapped. Creatures only partially within the area, or those too large to fit inside it, are pushed away from the center of the area until they are completely outside it.

A creature inside the cage can't leave it by nonmagical means. If the creature tries to use teleportation or interplanar travel to leave, it must first make a [[/save ability=cha dc=@attributes.spell.dc format=long]]. On a successful save, the creature can use that magic to exit the cage. On a failed save, the creature doesn't exit the cage and wastes the spell or effect. The cage also extends into the Ethereal Plane, blocking ethereal travel.

This spell can't be dispelled by Dispel Magic.

materials.value: ruby dust worth 1,500+ GP, which the spell consumes

H7r6crP5RmD7vxyK.name: Globe of Invulnerability
H7r6crP5RmD7vxyK.description:
An immobile, shimmering barrier appears in a 10-foot Emanation around you and remains for the duration.

Any spell of level 5 or lower cast from outside the barrier can't affect anything within it. Such a spell can target creatures and objects within the barrier, but the spell has no effect on them. Similarly, the area within the barrier is excluded from areas of effect created by such spells.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The barrier blocks spells of 1 level higher for each spell slot level above 6.

Spell levels blocked:[[@item.level - 1]] and lower

Maze.name: Maze
Maze.description:
You banish a creature that you can see within range into a labyrinthine demiplane. The target remains there for the duration or until it escapes the maze.

The target can take a Study action to try to escape. When it does so, it makes a DC 20 Intelligence (Investigation) check. If it succeeds, it escapes, and the spell ends.

When the spell ends, the target reappears in the space it left or, if that space is occupied, in the nearest unoccupied space.

Banished.name: Banished
Banished.description: The target can take a Study action to try to escape. When it does so, it makes a [[/check ability=int skill=inv dc=20]] check. If it succeeds, it escapes, and the spell ends.

Prismatic Spray.name: Prismatic Spray
Prismatic Spray.description:
Eight rays of light flash from you in a 60-foot Cone. Each creature in the Cone makes a Dexterity saving throw. For each target, roll 1d8 to determine which color ray affects it, consulting the Prismatic Rays table.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd5e.tables24.RollTable.phbPrismaticRays rollable=true caption=false]{Prismatic Rays}

Petrifying (Indigo).name: Petrifying (Indigo)
Petrifying (Indigo).description: The target has the &Reference[Restrained apply=false] condition and makes a [[/save ability=con format=long]] at the end of each of its turns. If it successfully saves three times, the condition ends. If it fails three times, it has the &Reference[Petrified] condition until it is freed by an effect like the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplGreaterRes]{Greater Restoration} spell. The successes and failures needn’t be consecutive; keep track of both until the target collects three of a kind.

Teleporting (Violet).name: Teleporting (Violet)
Teleporting (Violet).description: The target has the &Reference[Blinded apply=false] condition and makes a [[/save ability=wis format=long]] at the start of your next turn. On a successful save, the condition ends. On a failed save, the condition ends, and the creature teleports to another plane of existence (DM’s choice).

Prismatic Wall.name: Prismatic Wall
Prismatic Wall.description:
A shimmering, multicolored plane of light forms a vertical opaque wall—up to 90 feet long, 30 feet high, and 1 inch thick—centered on a point within range. Alternatively, you shape the wall into a globe up to 30 feet in diameter centered on a point within range. The wall lasts for the duration. If you position the wall in a space occupied by a creature, the spell ends instantly without effect.

The wall sheds &Reference[BrightLight] within 100 feet and &Reference[DimLight] for an additional 100 feet. You and creatures you designate when you cast the spell can pass through and be near the wall without harm. If another creature that can see the wall moves within 20 feet of it or starts its turn there, the creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or have the &Reference[Blinded apply=false] condition for 1 minute.

The wall consists of seven layers, each with a different color. When a creature reaches into or passes through the wall, it does so one layer at a time through all the layers. Each layer forces the creature to make a Dexterity saving throw or be affected by that layer's properties as described in the Prismatic Layers table.

The wall, which has AC 10, can be destroyed one layer at a time, in order from red to violet, by means specific to each layer. If a layer is destroyed, it is gone for the duration. @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplAntimagicF]{Antimagic Field} has no effect on the wall, and @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDispelMagi]{Dispel Magic} can affect only the violet layer.

Prismatic Layers
OrderEffects
1Red. Failed Save: 12d6 Fire damage. Successful Save: Half as much damage. Additional Effects: Nonmagical ranged attacks can't pass through this layer, which is destroyed if it takes at least 25 Cold damage.
2Orange. Failed Save: 12d6 Acid damage. Successful Save: Half as much damage. Additional Effects: Magical ranged attacks can't pass through this layer, which is destroyed by a strong wind (such as the one created by @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplGustofWind]{Gust of Wind}).
3Yellow. Failed Save: 12d6 Lightning damage. Successful Save: Half as much damage. Additional Effects: The layer is destroyed if it takes at least 60 Force damage.
4Green. Failed Save: 12d6 Poison damage. Successful Save: Half as much damage. Additional Effects: A @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplPasswall00]{Passwall} spell, or another spell of equal or greater level that can open a portal on a solid surface, destroys this layer.
5Blue. Failed Save: 12d6 Cold damage. Successful Save: Half as much damage. Additional Effects: The layer is destroyed if it takes at least 25 Fire damage.
6Indigo. Failed Save: The target has the &Reference[Restrained apply=false] condition and makes a [[/save ability=con dc=@attributes.spell.dc format=long]] at the end of each of its turns. If it successfully saves three times, the condition ends. If it fails three times, it has the &Reference[Petrified] condition until it is freed by an effect like the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplGreaterRes]{Greater Restoration} spell. The successes and failures needn't be consecutive; keep track of both until the target collects three of a kind. Additional Effects: Spells can't be cast through this layer, which is destroyed by Bright Light shed by the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDaylight00]{Daylight} spell.
7Violet. Failed Save: The target has the &Reference[Blinded apply=false] condition and makes a [[/save ability=wis dc=@attributes.spell.dc format=long]] at the start of your next turn. On a successful save, the condition ends. On a failed save, the condition ends, and the creature teleports to another plane of existence (DM's choice). Additional Effects: This layer is destroyed by @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDispelMagi]{Dispel Magic}.

range.special: measured from nearest point on wall or globe

Prismatic Blinding.name: Prismatic Blinding
Prismatic Blinding.description: The target has the &Reference[Blinded apply=false] condition for 1 minute.

Restrained (Indigo).name: Restrained (Indigo)
Restrained (Indigo).description: The target has the &Reference[Restrained apply=false] condition and makes a [[/save ability=con dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] format=long]] at the end of each of its turns. If it successfully saves three times, the condition ends. If it fails three times, it has the &Reference[Petrified] condition until it is freed by an effect like the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplGreaterRes]{Greater Restoration} spell.

Blinded (Violet).name: Blinded (Violet)
